The following loan will be much-welcomed during this period of heavy rains, since fruit is abundant on the market and sell well.  To this end, she is going to bolster her business by buying a case of tomatoes, a case of cabbage, a case of purple eggplant, 5 bags of onions, a case of mangoes, a bunch of chives, a bunch of parsley, celery, and other fruit and vegetables in season.  

Her children are young, and she is investing more in their education while feeding them appropriately.

Her ambition is to build house for stability in her life.

loans.use: Buying vegetables, such as cabbage, carrots, tomatoes, green beans; and fruit

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred S. is married to Violet Kavugwi and they have three children, 16, 13 and 12 years old. Fred has 8 years of experience in the construction industry. He is committed to giving powerful end results, making clients continue to build a lot of trust in his business. Fred is applying for his sixth loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans well and on time. To meet his customers' demand, he intends to buy construction materials for a contract. Fred was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. His future dream is to see his children realize their goals through better education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for a contract

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is  53 years old and a father of five. When you look into his sparkling eyes, you can notice his strong determination and great ambition.

Amer began his business with a small blacksmith shop  where his work was limited to the local neighborhood. His fine work gave him a good reputation and opened the door for new business out of Amman as he gained  a wide expertise in his field.

Amer is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase some needed tools and materials for his shop. An aspiration of Amer's is to expand his business and open another blacksmith shop outside Amman in addition to building a home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase some much needed tools and materials for his shop

loans.name: George Kihara

texts.en: George has practised farming in the town of Njabini for the last 20 years. He is 57 years old and takes care of his eight children after divorcing his wife. George was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He plans to use the cash to start a business selling bedsheets, blankets and bedcovers. In the future, George hopes to diversify to other fields and have many businesses in Njabini.

loans.use: to start a business selling bedsheets, blankets and bedcovers.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en: K. Cissy  lives in Kawala in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (brother and sister).  Cissy has a business selling religious articles. She has been in this business for nine years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Cissy sells her products door-to-door at retail. Cissy has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of candles, bibles, rosaries and other religious booklets. She also generates additional income through beads. The main business challenge(s) for Cissy include the rainy season and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only and to go directly to the producers. Cissy lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.Her major monthly expenses include rent school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of candles, bibles, rosaries and other religious booklets

loans.name: Ma-La-Neh Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Ma-La-Neh” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Adama K. is the leader of this group. The 36-year-old is married to a driver and they have seven children. Adama has been a businesswoman for 21 years now. She sells “gara lappers” (locally dyed clothes).  With her share of this loan, she will buy gara lapper making materials – ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc in order to produce a large quantity of gara lappers. 

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Zainab Bangura handing over the loan to the clients)

loans.use: To buy materiasl to make gara lappers

loans.name: Ejidio Munene

texts.en:
Ejidio, 32 years old, is married to Mercy and they have three children - 7 years old and twins of 2 months old. They also support their orphaned niece in school. Ejidio sells his items by moving from one place to another and his wife runs a cereals shop.

Ejidio is taking his third loan with KADET LTD and intends to buy assorted cereals for his wife’s business. He hopes to settle with the family in Embu, educate the children to a higher level and improve the family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy assorted cereals for his wife's business

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind is a Jordanian micro-entrepreneur. She is 42 years old. With great ambition and a passion for work, Hind started making handmade bed covers, OrientA. dresses and stitched frames out of her home to improve her family's standard of living.

She is requesting a loan of 300 JD to buy raw materials and expand her home-based project. She is looking forward to opening a licensed shop to increase her sales and widen her customer base.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and expand her home-based business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more vegetables

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.fr:
Il a une cabine qui a très bien marche , car ses revenus journaliers étaient de 35000f par jour, son objectif était après le premier prêt vendre les cartes prépayées en gros et il devait aussi multiplier ses point de ventes, il a débuté cet activité et commence à récolté quelques fruits

Le deuxième prêt  sera là pour continuer ce qu’il a débuté, en achetant les cartes de tous les réseaux téléphoniques de la ville comme MTN, AIRTEL,WARID..
Il compte aussi s'abonner a Congo Telecom pour avoir une ligne directe pour communication a bas prix.

Il est père d’une fille unique et veut s’investir dans son éducation en l’envoyant dans une école de métiers (coupe et couture).
Il pense aussi construire une maison dans sa parcelle pour sa future progéniture.
texts.en:
Jean Claude M. M. has a phone booth which is making money, as his daily profits have been 35,000 francs a day. With his first loan, his goal was to sell prepaid phone cards wholesale, and also increase the number of his retail outlets. He has started this business and is beginning to see some fruits of his labor.

The second loan will be used to continue what he has begun, by buying cards from all of the city's networks, such as MTN, Airtel, Warid, etc. He also plans to get an account with Congo Telecom in order to have a direct line for low-priced communication.

He is the father of one daughter and would like to invest in her education by sending her to a vocational school (to study tailoring/dressmaking). He also plans to build a house on his land for his future offspring.

loans.use: Telephone booth and sale of phone recharge cards

loans.name: Junks Sellers Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Junks Sellers” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Sallay K. is the leader of this group. Sallay is 40 years old and married with five children – two in primary school and two in secondary school. Sallay sells clothes, belts, socks, etc. With the help of this loan, Sallay will invest in her business by buying clothes, belts and socks in large quantity to add to her current ones. 

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Wallie Mansaray handing over the loan to the clients)

loans.use: To buy clothes, belts and socks to resell

loans.name: Elima Jepkochei

texts.en:
Elima K., 50 years old, is married and the mother of three children aged between 18 and 14 years. Elima's spouse, Benjamin Chepkonga, is a peasant farmer who supports her in their day-to-day financial and basic needs.
 
Elima runs a tailoring business which she started two years ago. She makes a monthly profit of KES 3,000. Elima has borrowed a loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD which she intends to use to purchase clothing materials to make new dresses to sell for the Christmas season. This is her second loan, having successfully repaid her first. Elima intends to use the profits to open a retail shop and expand her tailoring business. Her dreams and hopes are to open a big retail shop and to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials

loans.name: Dutanfaye Group

texts.fr: Damien R. est agriculteur du riz, et il est un membre du groupe Dufatanye. Il est marie, et il a 3 enfants entre 3 ans et 26 ans. Deux de ses enfants vont a l'ecole. Son niveau d'education est l'annee 5eme primaire, et il va utiliser son pret pour acheter des fertilisantes urees et NPK, et aussi pour le main d'oeuvre. Sa strategie pour la croissance de l'affaire est d'accroitre l'activite de l'agriculture du riz. Il voudrait accroitre les activites actuelles, et acheter une maison.
texts.en:
Damien R. is a rice farmer, and member of the Dufatanye group. He is married with three children, whose ages range from 3 to 26 years. Two of his children attend school, and he attended school himself until the 5th grade.

He will use his loan to buy urea fertilizers and NPK (Nitrogen Phosphorus Potassium), and also to hire field hands. His strategy for growing his business is to increase the rice-growing activity. He wants to raise his current activity level and buy a house.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, hire field hands.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah B. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Peninah has a tailoring business. She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days out of every week. Peninah sells her products in a shop on a retail basis.  

Peninah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more clothing materials. The main business challenges for Peninah include the rainy season and the ever-increasing prices of clothing materials. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only. 

Peninah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia N. lives in the Kawaala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her three sisters). 

Olivia has a charcoal-selling business. She has been in this business for seven years and she works seven days out of every week. Olivia sells her products from home on a retail basis. 

Olivia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through selling second-hand bags.

The main business challenges for Olivia include the rainy season and the ever-increasing prices of bags of charcoal. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on wholesale basis only and also to build more rental rooms. Olivia lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married, and the father of three children. Since Ali has a long experience in sales, in 2005 he decided to open his own food market. He is becoming well known and has a good reputation in the region.

He is requesting $1500 loan to expand his inventory and to buy a refrigerator. He is aiming to grow bigger and expand his work so he will be able to change his living conditions for the better.

loans.use: Increase his inventory and buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy drugs to sell in pharmacy

loans.name: Tianoh/go Forward Group

texts.en:
Bendu G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Tianoh/Go Forward.  She is 36 years old, married, and has three children who are between the ages of 10 to 2 years. She was only able to attend school through 5th grade due to financial constraints. 

For 20 years, she has been selling pepper, palm oil, rice, salt, etc. in Barnesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 25,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 48,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more pepper, palm oil, rice, salt, etc.

She describes herself as a hardworking woman whose goals are to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy pepper, palm oil, rice, salt, etc. for resale

loans.name: Everlyne Achieng

texts.en:
Everlyne O. is 27 years old, is from Usenge in Kisumu, and is married to Joseph Oduor. They have three children between the ages of nine years and three and half years.

Everlyne has a stall selling green groceries like tomatoes and onions. She is applying for her second loan from Kadet Ltd after successfully completing the first one. She will use the money to buy more onions and tomatoes to add to her stock, and also build a better stall as the one she is in  is old and worn out.

Her desire is to have a big grocery in the market centre.

loans.use: To buy onions and tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Ouasam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old. He is married and also supports one of his parents. He used to work in a supermarket, then he decided to open his own mini-market in 2009. He is becoming well known and has an excellent reputation in his local area.

He is requesting a $1800 loan to renovate his store and to buy two refrigerators. He is aiming to grow bigger and expand his business so he will be able to change his living standards for the better.

loans.use: Renovate his store and buy two refrigerators

loans.name: Ntayia Ole

texts.en:
Ntayia Ole has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the past year.  He is 36 years old, married to Naserian Ntayia, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy 15 sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Ntayia hopes to grow his business and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Najeh

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old. He is a husband and father of 5 children. In 2005, Najeh opened a men's wear store after he had worked and had experience in this field for 10 years. He has a good reputation within his region and he is very well-known. 

He is requesting a $1500 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to achieve a higher revenue from his store so as to expand later on.

loans.use: Pay the annual rent for his shop

loans.name: Sialo Ene

texts.en:
Sialo Ene has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last three years.  She is 32 years old, married to M. Lasiti, and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy 10 goats and 10 sheep which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Sialo wants to open a green grocer shop in town to diversify her income.

loans.use: To buy 10 goats and 10 sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Kintei Ole Tingoi

texts.en:
Kintei Ole has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last nine years.  He is 38 years old, married to Muinante Ene Kuntei, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy 15 sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Kintei hopes to increase the number of animals that he rears to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her niece and nephew).  

Betty has a business of a retail shop.  She has been in this business for five years and she works 7 days out of every week. Betty sells her products in the shop by means of retail. 

Betty has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap.  She also generates additional income through her rentals.

The main business challenges for Betty include transportation and competition. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and also to buy a plot of land to build more rental rooms.

Betty lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, and soap for resale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine K. lives in the Lugala Masanafu neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. Christine has a business selling fresh food. She has been in this business for 7 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Christine sells her products in a market by means of retail.    

Christine has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy sweet bananas, green bananas, onions, eggplants, pineapples cabbages, and tomatoes. She also generates additional income through cattle keeping.

The main business challenges for Christine include transportation and seasonality.   Her goal and aspiration for her business is to expand her business.   

Christine lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy fruit & vegetables for resale

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
El señor Rodrigo es soltero y no tiene hijos, pero vive con su tía la cual se encuentra enferma y el es el que la mantiene y se hace cargo de los gastos, vive en anticretico, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Bella Vista de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente es chofer propietario y trabaja en una línea de radio taxi en la ciudad de La Paz, además es técnico en electrónica y realiza trabajos en el hospital Corea ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto.
 El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de equipo de gas para la movilidad y así ahorrar en combustible. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is single and doesn't have any children but he lives with his aunt who is sick.  He looks after his aunt and takes care of her expenses.  They live in 'anticrético' (a special rental system particular to Bolivia) and their home is in the Bella Vista neighborhood of the city of La Paz.

Rodrigo is a taxi driver who owns his own taxi.  He works for a radio-taxi firm in the city of La Paz.  He is also an electronics technician and carries out work in Corea Hospital which is in the city of El Alto.

Rodrigo will use this loan to buy a gas system for his vehicle so that he can save on fuel.  He makes income for his household through his taxi work.

This is Rodrigo's first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies him favorably for a loan.

loans.use: To buy a liquefied natural gas (LNG) system for his vehicle and to change his fuel from gasoline to natural gas

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de muebles y también se dedica a la venta de artefactos como radios, televisores, equipos de sonido y otros artefactos, la socia trae artefactos de la ciudad de Tacna y lo vende a las diferentes personas y también vende a pedidos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artefactos al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Gladys belongs to the “Ricchary Cusco” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Gladys is 44 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  Gladys divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling furniture.  She also sells appliances such as radios, televisions, sound systems, etc.  She brings appliances from the city of Tacna and sells them to different people.  She also sells to order.  Gladys would like to expand her business.  She is requesting her loan to buy appliances wholesale.

Gladys is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy appliances wholesale

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
El señor Elvis es casado y tiene un hijo en edad escolar, vive en casa de sus padres y colabora con los gastos y pago de servicios; la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Chamaco Chico de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente es chofer propietario, trabaja en una línea de microbuses en la ciudad de La Paz además realiza tejido de mantas las cuales vende en las ferias.
El crédito lo utilizara para la reparación del motor de su movilidad. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Elvis is married and has one school-age child.  He lives in his parents' house and helps with household expenses and paying the bills.  The house is located in Chamaco Chico district, in the city of La Paz.

Elvis is an owner-driver.  He works a minibus route in the city of La Paz and also weaves blankets which he sells in markets.

Elvis will use his loan to repair his vehicle's engine as this is how he makes income for his household.

This is his first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have carried out qualifies him favorably for a loan.

loans.use: To have his vehicle serviced and its engine repaired

loans.name: Kikompii Ole

texts.en:
Kikompii Ole S. is 33 years old. He is married to Timanoi Ene Sinkayo and is a father of three school-going children. 

Kikompii is a farmer and does the farming on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last ten years.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan, which he plans to use on his farm to prepare it and buy farm supplies. The farm, being located along the main road, makes it easy for him to get customers for his maize.  With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm to increase his maize production.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant more maize for commercial purpose.

Kikompii is a hardworking man and is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To prepare land and buy farm supplies

loans.name: Joseph Muremi

texts.en:
Joseph has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town since 2006. He is 51 years old, married to Rahab Njeri, and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He paid for all his previous loan well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to stock up his shop by buying more dry foodstuff to sell.

In the future, Joseph hopes to open a wholesale in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy dry food stuff for resale

loans.name: Barbara Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Barbara Hilda; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también tiene una pensión restaurant, ella trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y pension restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la época navideña como panetones, chocolates y champañes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Barbara Hilda is a member of the “Ricchary Cusco” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Barbara Hilda is 43 years old.  She is single and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business which is a grocery store.  She also has a guest house / restaurant.  She works from 6.00am to 10.00pm.  She would like to expand and improve both of her businesses.  She is requesting this loan to buy products for the Christmas period such as panettones, chocolate and champagne.

She is grateful to those who are taking part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy products for the Christmas period such as panettones, chocolate and champagne

loans.name: Jhonnatan

texts.es:
El señor Jhonnatan es casado y tiene un bebe, vive en alquiler, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente trabaja como empleado de mantenimiento en un motel ya hace cuatro años y la esposa se dedica a vender electrodomésticos al crédito a clientes  en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería para que su esposa continue con el negocio. Es así como obtienen sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su segundo crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Jhonnatan is married and has a baby.  He rents a house in Sopocachi district, in the city of La Paz.

Jhonnatan works as a maintenance man in a motel.  He has been in this job for four years.  His wife sells household appliances on credit to customers in the city of La Paz.

Jhonnatan will use this loan to buy merchandise so that his wife can continue with her business.  This is how they make income for their household.

This is his second loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies him favorably for a loan.

loans.use: To buy household appliances so that his wife can continue in her business selling them on credit

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La  señora Mónica es soltera y  no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Vino Tinto de la ciudad de La Paz.
La Cliente tiene una tienda de repuestos y lubricantes para movilidades en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería y ampliación de su tienda, para mejorar la atención a sus clientes. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mónica is single and doesn't have any children.  She lives in her parents' house which is in the Vino Tinto district of the city of La Paz.

Mónica has a store where she sells spare parts and lubricants for vehicles.  It is located in Tembladerani district, in the city of La Paz.

She will use her loan to buy merchandise and expand her store so that she can provide her customers with a better service.  This is how she makes income for her household.

This is Mónica's first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies her favorably for a loan.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as spare parts and lubricants for her store

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, vive en casa propia que se encuentra en construcción, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente tiene un taller de carpintería en el cual trabaja desde hace 20 años juntamente con su esposa. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito lo utilizará para la refacción de su baño y cocina ya que se está instalando en su zona gas a domicilio y quiere aprovechar la oportunidad para tener las tuberías listas e instaladas. Es su segundo crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mario is married and has four children.  He lives in his own home which is still being built.  It is located in Pasankeri district, in the city of La Paz.

Mario has a carpentry workshop where he has been working for 20 years together with his wife.  This is how he makes income for his household.

He will use his loan to refurbish his bathroom and kitchen since they are starting to connect the gas supply to homes in his district and he wants to take advantage of the opportunity and have the pipes ready and installed.  This is his second loan and the socio-economic analysis which we have performed qualifies him favorably for a loan.

loans.use: To refurbish his bathroom and kitchen.  To install gas pipes since they are beginning to connect the gas supply to homes in his district

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Martha Isabel; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos, la socia vende en forma independiente llevando al público en general y también a los amigos, la socia quiere tener una tienda para poder la ropa y los cosméticos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa y cosméticos al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Martha Isabel belongs to the “Ricchary Cusco” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Martha Isabel is 46 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling clothes and cosmetics.  She sells independently, offering her products to the general public and also to her friends.  She would like to have a store where she can sell her clothes and cosmetics.  She is requesting this loan so that she can buy clothes and cosmetics wholesale.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy clothes and cosmetics wholesale

loans.name: Amancia Isabel

texts.es:
Amancia de 55 años, tiene una farmacia en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín en una casa que cuenta con agua y luz como los servicios básicos.  

Empezó hace 6 años atrás con un capital de $ 300.00 en medicinas, con esfuerzo y dedicación incremento ese capital por la buena atención que daba a sus clientes. Para incrementar sus ingresos también hace costuras a ropas. Trabaja vendiendo medicinas desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm en la parte delantera de su casa donde ubico su negocio.   Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicinas para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere agranda su negocio y surtirlo con mercadería de ferretería. Y que su familia tenga una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Amancia is 55 years old.  She has a pharmacy in the front part of her home.  She lives in a peri-urban area called Fortín in a house which has water and light as basic services.

She started her business 6 years ago with a working capital of $300 in medicines.  Through hard work, determination and the good service which she provides to her customers, she managed to increase this capital.

To increase her income, Amancia also sews clothes.  She sells medicines from 6.00am to 9.00pm from the front part of her home where her business is located.  She will use her loan to buy medicines for her business.

In the future, she would like to expand her business and stock it with hardware merchandise.  She would also like her family to have a better life.

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jorge es divorciado y tiene 3 hijos ya mayores, vive en anticretico junto a sus 2 sobrinos por que sus padres se encuentran en el exterior y Jorge se hace cargo; la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente es ingeniero en sistemas pero trabaja en su domicilio independientemente armando todo tipo de computadoras. El crédito lo utilizara para abastecerse de material en computación, y poder armar mejor su taller. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Jorge is divorced and has 3 grown-up children.  He lives in 'anticrético' (a rental system particular to Bolivia).  He lives together with his two nephews as their parents are abroad and Jorge takes care of them. The house is located in Sopocachi district, in the city of La Paz.

Jorge is a systems engineer but he is self employed and works from home, assembling all kinds of computers.  He will use his loan to stock up on computer materials and to better furnish his workshop.  This is how he makes income for his household.

This is Jorge's first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies him favorably for a loan.

loans.use: To buy materials to assemble and fix computer equipment

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Miguel Angel; el tiene 37 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con la enseñanza de capacitación de educación, el es profesor, el socio quiere seguir saliendo adelante como profesional y sacar adelante a sus hijos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su casa y uso personal.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel is a member of the “Ricchary Cusco” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Miguel Angel is 37 years old.  He is married and has 2 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his teacher training job.  He is a teacher.  He would like to continue getting ahead in life as a professional and get his children ahead too.  He is requesting this loan to maintain his home and for personal use.

He is grateful to those who will take part in his dream by funding his loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To maintain his house and for personal use

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles K. is 50 years old and is married to Rosaline Cherop, who runs a dairy farm.  He has seven children which he supports, and also supports his parents.  His children are of the following ages: 26 years, 24 years, 18 years(twins), 16 years, 14 years, and 12 years.

Charles does farming, planting and selling watermelons.  He has been in business for two years and his monthly income from the business is Ksh 50,000.  He is borrowing a loan of Ksh 50,000 from KADET LTD, and will use the loan to purchase watermelon seeds and pay labour cost.  He will use the anticipated profit to build a shop and to pay his children school fees. 

This is his fourth loan.  His previous loan have been successfully paid.  His hopes and dreams is to expand the business and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and pay labour cost

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
La señora Nora es casada y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, vive en casa propia que esta en construcción, en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
La cliente trabaja realizando atención odontológica a personas de escasos recursos en una zona popular ya hace cuatro años. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de medicamentos al por mayor y así realizar mejor su trabajo y  poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Es su cuarto crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Nora is married and has a 2 year-old child.  She lives in her own home, which is still being built, in Llojeta district, in the city of La Paz.

Nora provides dental work to people of limited economic means in a popular district of the city.  She has been doing this job for four years and it is how she makes income for her household.

This is her fourth loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies her favorably for a new loan.

loans.use: To buy medicines wholesale for her work as a dentist

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos V. A. tiene 31 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañera y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALL PARAISO se encuentra ubicada 120 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Juan Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa para los hijos.

Le gusta tener amigos y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos V. A. is 31 years old. He lives in a common law marriage with a companion and his children. He lives in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar. He has 2 children. 

The members of  the rural community bank VALL PARAISO are found 120 minutes from the Chillanes office, which belongs to the Chillanes canton. This bank is dedicated to short cycle agricultural work. He grows cacao, and has been doing this for a long time. 

Juan Carlos works in agriculture and has been growing cacao for 2 years. He buys his products in Matilde Esther and sells them in the Chillanes market and in the same community.  

He is asking for the loan to buy agricultural materials and fertilizers to grow cacao. The support of the loan will help him meet his financial needs. He faces challenges such as pests and diseases and weather variation. His dream is to buy a house for his children. 

He likes to have friends and listen to music.

loans.use: Agricultural materials and fertilizers to grow cacao

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El señor German es soltero y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, vive en casa de sus padres ayudando en la casa con los gastos por que sus padres son mayores de edad, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente es chofer propietario y trabaja en una línea de radio taxi en la ciudad de La Paz, el crédito lo utilizara para la compra de una radio con frecuencia de comunicación. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
German is single and has two school age children.  He lives in his parents’ house and helps cover household expenses because his parents are elderly.  The house is located in La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.

He is an owner-driver and works in on of La Paz’s radio dispatched taxi services.  He will use the loan to buy a short wave radio.  

This is his source of income for his home.

It is his first loan and the socioeconomic evaluation made qualifies him favorably to access a loan.

loans.use: To buy a short wave radio for his taxi.

loans.name: Mariana Alexandra

texts.es:
Mariana de 19 años,  es madre soltera con un niño de 1 año, tiene una pequeña papelería en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una casa que solo cuenta con luz como servicio ubicada en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín. 

Decidió aprender cómo administrar una papelería para poder mantener a su hijo. Con unos ahorros compro papelería para venderla en la parte delantera de su casa. En l actualidad tiene distribuida su propia papelería con cuadernos, plumas, laminas etc. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y artículos para la papelería. 

En el futuro quiere tener bien surtido de mercadería su negocio para que sus ventas se incrementen y asi poderle dar una buena vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mariana, 19, is a single mother of a one year old son.  She has a small stationery shop in the front part of her house.  She lives in a house that’s only utility is electricity located in a periurban zone called Fortín.

She decided to learn how to run a stationery shop to support her son.  She used her savings to buy stationery items to sell in the front part of her house.  She currently has her shop stocked with notebooks, pens, diagrams, etc.  She is open from 7am until 8pm every day.  She wants to use the loan to buy notebooks, pens and other stationery items.

In the future she’d like to have her store well stocked with merchandise so that sales will increase thus being able to provide her son with a good life.

loans.use: For notebooks and pens.

loans.name: Karla Elisa

texts.es: Karla es una mujer muy alegre y a demás responsable ella tiene1 hijo y está a su cargo. Hace 3 años que se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general dicha actividad la realiza de una manera permanente porque cuando comenzó a trabajar fue por razón que como madre comprometida y responsable decidió ayuda a los ingresos de la familia ya que tenía que sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que por las mañanas realizaba la lo quehaceres del hogar y por las tardes sale a vender sus diferentes productos. Actualmente solicita un financiamiento para la compra de sabanas, toallas, perfumes y calzado. Su deseo es seguir esforzándose para que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Karla is a very cheerful, responsible woman.  She has a son in her care.  For three years she has sold general merchandise.  This is now her permanent occupation because she started to work, like all committed mothers, to contribute to household income because she wanted to provide for her son.  During the mornings she could do the household chores and then in the afternoon she could sell her various products.

She is asking for this current loan to buy sheets, towels, perfumes and footwear.  Her wish is to continue to strengthen so that her children will not lack their daily food.

loans.use: To buy sheets, towels, perfume and footwear.

loans.name: Welinton Eduardo

texts.es:
Welinton Eduardo A. M. tiene 45 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALL PARAISO se encuentra ubicada 120 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Welinton se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y construir una vivienda.

Le gusta tener amigos.
texts.en:
Welinton Eduardo A. M., 45, is married living with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has five children.

The members of the VALL PARAISO communal bank are located 120 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  It is part of Chillanes canton and the bank is dedicated to short cycle cocoa bean farming.  They have been in this line of work for a long time.

Welinton has been farming cocoa beans for two years.  He buys his supplies in Matilde Esther and sells his products in the Chillanes market and in his own settlement.

He is asking for funds to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for the cocoa bean crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and weather changes.  His dream is to buy land and build a house.

He likes having friends.

loans.use: For farming supplies and fertilizers for the cocoa bean crops.

loans.name: Héctor Floresmilo

texts.es:
Héctor Floresmilo  A. G. tiene 37 años. Es soltero, vive con la hermana, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALL PARAISO se encuentra ubicada 120 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Héctor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y construir una vivienda.

Le gusta escuchar música y salir a pasear.
texts.en:
Héctor Floresmilo  A. G., 37, is single living with his sister in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has no children..

The members of the VALL PARAISO communal bank are located 120 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  It is part of Chillanes canton and the bank is dedicated to short cycle cocoa bean farming.  They have been in this line of work for a long time.

Welinton has been farming cocoa beans for two years.  He buys his supplies in Matilde Esther and sells his products in the Chillanes market and in his own settlement.

He is asking for funds to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for the cocoa bean crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and weather changes.  His dream is to buy land and build a house.

He enjoys listening to music and going on outings.

loans.use: For farming supplies and fertilizers for the cocoa bean crops.

loans.name: Yayanmarca Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “YAYANMARCA”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en la comunidad de Yayanmarca,  distrito de Cusipata, provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ubaldina ;   La socia  es conviviente  y tiene 6 hijos , la socia tiene 35 años de edad;  la socia a los largo de su vida a tenido que trabajar en todo lo que sea posible y pudiera darle una remuneración a cambio, ella sin estudios secundarios terminados y creyendo como era en la antigüedad a mayor número de hijos mayor posibilidad de labrar las tierras de cultivo y obtener mayor dinero para comer y tener salud esas prioridades la llevaron a no tener una planificación familiar y sin más que hacer ella debe dividirse y trabajar de sol a sol, la socia trabaja vendiendo productos secos (maíz, papa seca, habas, granos, quinua, frejoles, pallares ) y alterna con la venta de animales menores  (cuyes, y aves de corral); ella vende en el mercado de Combapata, la socia también cuando le traen los proveedores de la selva peruana hojas de coca en poca cantidad, las lleva a vender en su mismo stand en el mercado, la hoja de coca es considerada una planta sagrada y en la antigüedad los inkas la cultivaban, actualmente es parte de nuestra cultura y solo se le reconoce los propiedades y no más así como una droga, en la sociedad andina está hoja es tan sagrada como para poder perjudicarla con el mal empleo que le dan algunos humanos en contra de otros humanos. La socia con lo que le genera la venta de sus productos y animales menores educa y alimenta a sus menores hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar animales menores y algunos productos secos que no cultiva ella.  
Los otros socios alternan sus actividades con el comercio minorista, ellos  se dedican a moler granos, los socios tiene en su mayoría pequeñas y grandes máquinas de molinos los cuales las alquilan al pueblo para moler los diferentes productos y estos poder vender al por mayor a las ciudades de casi todo el Perú.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ubaldina, 35, is a member of the ‘YAYANMARCA” communal bank which is located in the community of Yayanmarca, Cusipata district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.

She has a life partner and six children.  Throughout her life she has had to work at whatever was possible that would produce income in exchange.  Not having finished secondary school and believing, like in the old days, that the more children one had the greater ability to cultivate the fields and earn more money to eat and have health, those priorities led her not to plan her family.  With no other alternative now, she must split herself up to work from sun to sun.

She works selling dry goods (maize, dehydrated potato, L. beans, grains, Quinoa, broad beans, pallares beans).  She also sells small farm animals (guinea pigs and barnyard fowl).  She sells in the Combapata market.  In addition, when suppliers bring coca leaves from the Peruvian jungle in small amounts she takes them to her stand in the market to sell too.  Coca leaf is considered to be a sacred plant and Incas grew it in antiquity.  It’s currently part of our cultures and it’s known only for its properties, not as a drug.  In Andean society this leaf is too sacred to desecrate using it for evil like some humans do against other humans. With what her sales of products and small animals produce she educates and feeds her minor children.

She is asking for a loan to buy small farm animals and a few dry goods that she does not grow herself.

The other group members alternate their activities with retail sales.  They grind grains.  Most of them have small or large mills that they least out in town to grind various products which the people can then go sell at wholesale in cities throughout most of Perú.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and at the same time pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy small farm animals and a few dry grains that she doesn't grow.

loans.name: Luis Milton

texts.es:
Luis Milton M. A. tiene 44 años. Es soltero, vive con los padres, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALL PARAISO se encuentra ubicada 120 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro.
Le gusta ser muy respetuoso, amable y  escuchar música .
texts.en:
Luis Milton M. A., 44, is single and lives with his parents in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has no children.

The members of the VALL PARAISO communal bank are located 120 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  It is part of Chillanes canton and the bank is dedicated to chores related to short cycle cocoa bean farming.  They have been in this line of work for a long time.

Luis has been a cocoa bean farmer for 2 years.  He buys his supplies in Matilde Esther and sells his products at the Chillanes market and in his own settlement.

He is asking for funds to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for the cocoa bean crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and weather changes.  His dream is to buy a car.

He enjoys being respectful and kind and to listen to music.
 .

loans.use: For farming supplies and fertilizers for cocoa bean crops.

loans.name: Aracelly Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Aracelly Del Carmen tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La señora tiene un negocio que es salón de belleza, el cual está localizado en su casa de habitación. La señora dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 9 años, Ella empezó con este negocio, después de que unas amigas le enseñaran este medio de vida que es importante y sus mismas amigas le enviaban clientes para que practicara y se diera a conocer. Después fue ampliando su negocio, ya que ofrecía un buen servicio y los mismos clientes se encargaban de enviarles a otros clientes. El crédito solicitado por la señora será invertido en la compra de planchas, peines, talcos entre otras cosas. El sueño que tiene la señora, es ampliar su negocio que brinde mayor estabilidad económica a ella y a su familia.
texts.en: Aracelly del Carmen has two minor children who she is raising.  She has a business that is a beauty salon, which is located in her home.  She started this business nine years ago.  She started working in this after some friends taught her this way to live that is now so important to her.  Her friends sent her customers to practice on and to get to know.  Afterwards, she began to expand her business as she was offering a good service and her customers took on the task of sending her more customers.  The loan she requested will be invested in buying flat irons, combs, and talcum powder, among other things.  Her dream is to expand her business so that she can offer better economic stability to her family.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Arturo Adan

texts.es:
Arturo Adan L. S. tiene 73 años. Es viudo, vive con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALL PARAISO se encuentra ubicada 120 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Arturo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es cambiar la situación económica para el bienestar de su familia.

Le gusta la música y tener muchos amigos.
texts.en:
Arturo Adan L. S. is 73 years old.  He is a widower, he lives with his children, and lives in the town of Chillanes in the Bolivar Province.

The members of the V.R.C Valle Paraiso (Paradise Valley) are located 120 minutes from the Chillanes office in the town of Chillanes.  This service point works with short season agricultural activities like cacao growing, which they have been doing for a long time.

Arturo has worked in agriculture growing cacao for the last two years.  He buys products from Matilde Esther and sells them in the Chillanes fair and in the same store where he makes his purchases.

He is requesting the loan to purchase agricultural additives and fertilizers for cacao cultivation.  With the support of the loan, it would help him economically to meet his needs.  His plants have to face problems like pests, diseases, and weather variations.  His dream is to change his economic situation for the well-being of his family.

He enjoys music and having many friends.

loans.use: Agricultural additives and fertilizers for cacao cultivation

loans.name: Consuelo Janeth

texts.es:
Consuelo Janeth M. M. tiene 36 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañera y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALL PARAISO se encuentra ubicada 120 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Consuelo Janeth  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro.

Le gusta pasear.
texts.en:
Consuelo Janeth M. M. is 36-years-old.  She lives in a common law marriage with her partner and her children.  They live in the town of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.  She has four children.

The members of the V.R.C Valle Paraiso (Paradise Valley) are located 120 minutes from the Chillanes office in the town of Chillanes.  This service point works with short season agricultural activities like cacao growing, which they have been doing for a long time.

Consuelo Janeth works in agriculture growing cacao and has for the past two years.  She buys products from Matilde Esther and sells them in the Chillanes fair and in the same store where she makes her purchases.

She is requesting the loan to buy agricultural additives and fertilizers for cacao cultivation.  With the support of the loan, it will help her to meet her economic needs.  She faces challenges with her plants like pests, disease, and weather variation.  Her dream is to buy a car.

She enjoys going for walks.

loans.use: Agricultural additives and fertilizers for cacao cultivation.

loans.name: Noema Aracely

texts.es:
Noema Aracely P. G. tiene 36 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALL PARAISO se encuentra ubicada 120 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Noema Aracely se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es esforzarse mucho.

Le gusta leer la sagrada Biblia.
texts.en:
Noema Aracely P. G. is 36-years-old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children.  She lives in the town of Chillanes in the Bolivar Province.  She has four children.

The members of the V.R.C Valle Paraiso (Paradise Valley) are located 120 minutes from the Chillanes office in the town of Chillanes.  This service point works with short season agricultural activities like cacao growing, which they have been doing for a long time.

Noema Aracely works in agriculture growing cacao and has for the past two years.  She buys products from Matilde Esther and sells them in the Chillanes fair and in the same store where she makes her purchases.

She is requesting the loan to buy agricultural additives and fertilizers for cacao cultivation.  With the support of the loan, it will help her to meet her economic needs.  She faces challenges with her plants like pests, disease, and weather variation.  Her dream is to work very hard.

She likes to read the sacred Bible.

loans.use: Agricultural additives and fertilizers for cacao cultivation

loans.name: Bella Mariana

texts.es:
Bella de 52 años,  es viuda y tiene  dos hijos que ya son mayores de edad pero vive sola en una zona periurbana  llamada Paraíso. 

Ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa y un pequeño taller de costura y confección donde le ingresan ropas de todo tipo para enmendaduras, confección. En la tienda vende pollos, arroz, huevos y en su taller de costura hace confecciones trabaja en las dos actividades turnándose según como sea el movimientos de los pedidos. 

Para seguir trabajando en su taller de costura ella quiere comprar con el préstamo un máquina de coser, telas. En el futuro quiere comprar maquinas de coser para tener empleados que le ayuden y así tener más producción.
texts.en:
Bella is 52-years-old.  She is a widow and has two children that are now adults, but she lives by herself in a suburban zone called Paraíso (Paradise).

She has a small store in the front of her house and a small sewing workshop where all kinds of clothing are brought in for mending or sewing.  In the store she sells chicken, rice, and eggs and in her sewing workshop she makes garments.  She works in both of these activities depending on how her orders go.

In order to continue working in her sewing workshop, she would like to purchase with her loan a sewing machine and fabrics.  In the future she would like to buy more sewing machines in order to have employees to help her and thus increase production.

loans.use: Sewing machine, fabrics

loans.name: Regulo Roberto

texts.es:
Regulo Roberto C. G. tiene 40 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALL PARAISO se encuentra ubicada 120 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Regulo Roberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es esforzarse mucho.

Le gusta leer la sagrada Biblia.
texts.en:
Regulo Roberto C. G., 40, is married.  He lives with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has four children.

Members of the VALL PARAISO communal bank are located 120 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  It is part of Chillanes canton.  The bank is dedicated to short cycle crop farming, like cocoa beans.  They have been in this line of work for a long time.

Regulo Roberto has been a cocoa bean farmer for two years.  He buys his products in Matilde Esther and sells at the Chillanes market and in his own settlement.

He is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his cocoa bean crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and variations in the weather.  His dream is to put in much effort.

He enjoys reading the Holy Bible.

loans.use: For farming supplies and fertilizers for cocoa bean crops.

loans.name: Mario Santiago

texts.es: Mario Santiago tiene 30 años, su estado civil es casado. El se dedica al destace de cerdo. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio vendiendo pocos cerdos, ya que no tenía mucho capital de trabajo. Por lo que el principal objetivo es satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes ofreciéndoles lo que ellos solicitan. Es así como recurre a Fundación León 2000 ya que por medio ella las organizaciones amigas dan el apoyo necesario y solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para materia prima. El deseo de Mario es mejorar cada día más su negocio.
texts.en: Mario Santiago is married and 30 years old.  He butchers pigs and has been doing this work for more than nine years.  He began by selling a few pigs; he did not have much working capital.  His goal is to satisfy his customers by offering what they request; therefore, he turned to Fundación León 2000 (local lending institution) to ask for this loan, which will be used as working capital, for the purchase of raw material.  Mario's desire is to improve his business every day.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernán vive en la zona de llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es artesano, preparador de calzados y su esposa elabora todo tejido en lana.
Es casado y tiene tres hijas
El crédito será destinado para la compra de una computadora, que le servirá para los estudios de sus hijas ya que una esta por entrar a la universidad y dos están en colegio nivel secundario.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva.
texts.en:
Hernán lives in the Llojeta neighborhood in the city of La Paz.
He is a craftsman who makes footwear, and his wife crochets a wide variety of items from wool.
He is married and has three daughters.
This loan willl be used to purchase a computer for his daughters' school work.  One is entering the university, and the other two are in high school.
This is the second time that he has requested a loan from IMPRO (local lending institution), and the second time that he has requested the help of Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer for his daughters.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 50 años se dedica a los bordados en hilo para elaborar trajes típicos D. su región, este arte que le enseñó su madre le ayudó bastante para poder ahora independizarse. Para ello cuenta con un taller D. bordadura, que es muy conocida por su zona, ya que el trabajo que realiza es muy apreciado por sus clientes, por ello son muchos lo que acuden a su taller, considera que su actividad  es rentable ya que sus clientes están dispuestos a pagar el precio  porque lo consideran justo por la calidad y acabado que entrega. Por otro lado, Albina también conoce las técnicas D. cultivo, así como el cuidado D. los animales. Es así que día a día trabaja cuando pueD. en el campo, pero cuando tiene mucho pedidos para bordar, contrata mano D. obra para que se encarguen D. la producción D. su cosecha. En adelante, tiene planeado intensificarse en la agricultura. Es el crédito número 2 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. más hilos y telas para sus bordados, así mismo comprará sacos D. abono para sembrar maíz.
texts.en:
Albina is 62, she lives with her husband in their own house. She has worked for more than 50 years embroidering with thread the typical dress of her region. This art, which her mother taught her, has greatly helped her to be able to now become independant. For this work she has an embroidery workshop, which is very well known in her zone since the work she produces is much appreciated by her customers and it is for this reason that many come to her workshop. She considers her activity to be profitable since her customers agree to pay her prices because they consider them fair for the quality and finish that she delivers.

On the other hand, Albina is also familiar with cultivation techniques, as well as animal husbandry. This is how she works day to day when she can in the countrysiD.. However, when she has many embroidery orders she hires labour to take care of the production of her harvest. From now on, she plans to intensify in agriculture. This is loan number 2 that she has had with [field partner] MFP and is very happy to know that she has financial support. As well, she is pleased to be a part of her communal bank because all its members are responsible people and very supportive. She thanks all the people who will be providers of the loan that she requests as it will be very useful for the progress of her business. The loan she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of more thread and fabric for her embroidery, as well, she will buy sacs of fertilizer for the planting of maize.

loans.use: To buy thread and fabric for her embroidery, as well as sacs of fertilizer for the planting of maize.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora tiene 29 años vive con sus 2 hijos en casa de su madre. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a elaborar tejidos en base a telares que su madre le enseñó aplicar, desde entonces hacer diversos trabajos en prendas de vestir. En la actualidad recibe los pedidos de sus clientes, que son fabricantes de mochilas  artesanales y requieren de tiras hechas en telares, por lo que  Dora sabe realizar con excelencia este trabajo. Esta actividad lo hace desde la comodidad de su casa y con ayuda de su madre, puede atender a sus hijos. Asimismo menciona que le gusta su trabajo, por que le permite tener ingresos para su familia y cumplir con los demás roles que tiene en su hogar, tiene el gran deseo en adelante de implementar su taller de tejidos y mejorar su producción. Es el crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más lana y en diversos colores, ya que debe continuar con la elaboración de tejidos.
texts.en:
Dora is 29 years old.  She lives with her 2 children in her mother's house.  Since she was a child she has been weaving with a loom, a skill which she was taught by her mother.  She does different work on items of clothes.  She currently receives orders from her customers who make backpacks by hand and who need straps woven on looms.  Dora is an expert at this work.  She does her work from the comfort of her own home and, with the help of her mother, she is able to look after her children too.  She comments that she likes her work because it makes income for her family and allows her to fill the other roles which she has in her household.  She has a great wish in the future to keep her weaving workshop running and improve her production.

This is Dora's second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and she likes being part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of one another.  She is grateful to those people who will fund her loan since it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will use her loan to invest in buying more wool in different colors since she must continue with her weaving work.

loans.use: To buy different colored wool in bulk

loans.name: Norlan Jose

texts.es: Norlan José tiene 36 años, esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos. Su actividad es la carpintería. Inicio hace 7 años, pues siempre está buscando la forma mejorar su negocio y la calidad de vida anteriormente Norlan se dedicaba a brindar el servicio de triciclo y ha sido con el paso del tiempo que ha mejorado su negocio. Es una persona que disfruta de su actividad ya que tiene ciertos pedidos para esta semana. El crédito será invertido en la compra de madera, herramientas, maque entre otras cosas necesarias.
texts.en: Norlan José is 36 years old.  This is not the first time that he has requested a loan.  He works as a carpenter and started his business 7 years ago.  He is always looking for ways to improve his business and his quality of life.  He used to provide a 'triciclo' (three-wheeled cycle) service and over time he has improved his business.  He is a person who enjoys his work and he has a number of orders.  His loan will be invested in buying wood, tools and varnish, along with other things he needs.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es:
José  de 47 años,  es maestro albañil desde hace 7 años atrás. Vive con su esposa e hijo de 16 años en el Paraíso zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y lomas. 

Aprendió hacer maestro albañil para poder mantener a su familia hace 7 años atrás trabaja con la ayuda de su hermano. Para tener más ingresos el también vende pescados. Trabaja desde las 03h00 de la madrugada en el mercado vendiendo pescados hasta las 06h00am que comienza a trabajar como maestro albañil en diferentes construcciones según lo contraten. 

Con el préstamo quiere arreglar su casa comprando con el préstamo cemento, pinturas, bloques. En el futuro quiere tener un local para ubicar un negocio.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old.  He has been a master builder for 7 years.  He lives with his wife and 16 year-old son in El Paraíso, a district which is noted for its dirt roads and hills.

José learned his trade seven years ago so that he could support his family.  His brother helps him in his work.  To make more income for his family he also sells fish.  He works from 3.00am in the market selling fish until 6.00am when he starts his building work on different building sites as and when he is hired.

He will use his loan to fix up his house.  He will buy cement, paint and blocks. In the future he would like to have premises to set up a business.

loans.use: To buy cement and blocks

loans.name: Josè Joaquín

texts.es:
Josè Joaquín M. C.  tiene 50 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALL PARAISO se encuentra ubicada 120 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Josè Joaquín se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es esforzarse mucho.

Le gusta tener amistades.
texts.en:
Josè Joaquín M. C.  is 50, married, and he lives with his wife and 2 children in the Chillanes canton, Bolivar province.

The members of the V.R.C. Vall Paraiso are located 120 minutes from the Chillanes office, in Chillanes province.  This rural group has been doing agricultural work for a long time in the short cacao growing season.

Josè Joaquín has been planting cacao for 2 years.  He buys his products in Matilde Esther and sells them in the Chillanes market and in the same fairground.

He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for cacao cultivation.  The financing will help him cover his expenses.  He has to deal with plagues and diseases and the variation in the weather.  He dream is to work hard.

He likes to have friends.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizer for cacao cultivation

loans.name: Pedro Oswaldo

texts.es:
Pedro Oswaldo A. G. tiene 40 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALL PARAISO se encuentra ubicada 120 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Pedro Oswaldo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar el negocio.

Le gusta trabajar mucho.
texts.en:
Pedro Oswaldo A. G. is 40-years-old. He's married and lives with his wife and her children. He lives in the district of Chillanes in the Bolívar province. He doesn't have children. 

The members of the V.R.C Vall Paraiso are located 120 minutes from the office in Chillanes. This solidarity group specializes in agricultural work such as short cycle cacao harvesting. They've done this for a long time. 

Pedro Oswaldo as grown cacao for 2 years. He buys his products in Matilde Esther and sells them in and around the fair in Chillanes. 

He's requesting this loan to buy agricultural products and fertilizer to cultivate the cacao. The support from this loan would help him economically in supplementing his necessities. He faces challenges such as plagues, plant illnesses, and bad weather. His dream is to improve his business.

He likes working a lot.

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural products and fertilizers for harvesting cacao

loans.name: Miguel Arcangel

texts.es:
Miguel Arcangel L. L.  tiene 43 años. Vive con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5  hijos.
