Now she has some problems because her field has infertile soil and a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mrs. Hem Y. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. 

She is a mother of four children, one of whom is employed in garment factoR. while the others are attending in public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Mr. Pros Koeng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people who live in Boeng Tumnob village in Takeo province are making up this village bank loan. All the members have selected Mr. Pros K. to be the village bank loan president. They will use their portion of this loan for different purposes to improve their families' living. 

Mr. Pros K. and his wife, Mrs. Nhor Thlang, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support their family.  He is also a village chief who receives a low salary.  On his plantation, he has problems because his field has infertile soil and has a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mr. Pros K. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. 

He is a father of two children, one of whom is employed in garment factory while the other is a laborer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Mrs. Soem Yeu Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Soem Y. is the village bank president for this loan, selected by the twelve people in Trapeang Ronoung village in Takeo province who make up this loan.  The members will use their portion of the loan to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Soem Y. raises and sells ducks to earn money to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand.  For this purpose, Mrs. Soem Y. is seeking a loan to buy more ducklings. Her husband, Mr. Sokhorn Nub, is a palm juice collector who earns some money from selling palm sugar. Through these activities they support five children, two of whom are students and the others are helping in their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy ducklings to raise and sell

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette E. is 48 years old, married, and supports her family by operating 3 business ventures:   a general store, a ready-to-wear clothes business, and an Avon products business.  

She lives in Prk. 9 Acco, Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for 15 yrs and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, ready-to-wear clothes and Avon products businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.   She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. 

Suzette is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell.   This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Suzette aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase stocks to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Nhanh Mom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people in Trapeang Ronoung village in Takeo province are making up this village bank loan. Mrs. N. M. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members.  The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living.    

Mrs. N. M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Huot Brak, is a traditional medicine man and he is also a chicken breeder. Since her husband’s chicken breeding is going well, she wants to expand. Mrs. N. M. is applying for a loan to buy more chickens. 

She is 33 years old and has three children, one of whom is doing housework while the others are studying in public school.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva S. is from the village of Tinagaan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Oliva is separated from her spouse and has 7 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Oliva owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snack foods in the local community. Oliva has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Oliva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oliva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Oliva is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like snack foosd & instant noodles. 

This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Oliva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products for resale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet M. is from the village of Bug-ong, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Juliet is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of coconuts for coco charcoal in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts to sell as coco charcoal

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly T. is a widow who lives in Prk. 9 Acco, Brgy. Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and a food vending business. 

Nelly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 24 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nelly has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 25th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to buy more stocks of goods to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future needs of her family.  Nelly T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold C. Jr. is from the village of Port Area, Iligan City. He is 23 years old. Arnold is single. To make a living, Arnold owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing Internet and computer services to local community members. Arnold has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arnold joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arnold has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Arnold is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional computer sets. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Arnold from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional computers

location.town: Port Area, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita D. is from the village of Aguinaldo Cordon. She is 37 years old. Conchita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Conchita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Conchita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Conchita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Junilla

texts.en:
Junilla M. is from the city of Labinay Ozamiz City. She is 24 years old and single. To make a living, Junilla owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating service-based  services. Junilla has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Junilla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Junilla is requesting a new loan of 27000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Junilla from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Mrs. Thanh Puy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people who are made up a village bank loan have selected Mrs. Thanh P. to be village bank president. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes in which it can improve their family living in Samraong village, TaK. province. 

To earn a daily income, Mrs. Thanh P. sells chickens to  clients who come to buy. She buys young chicks, raises them and then she slaughters and prepares them for sale  at her house. She is also a pig breeder. To increase her income, Mrs. Thanh P. is seeking a loan to buy more chickens to resell. She is a widow and has five children, three of whom are employed in the garment factories, and two are studying in school.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to resell

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia M. is 57-years old, married and supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  a General Store and a  Carinderia (eatery) business. She lives in  Brgy. Prosperidad, San Carlos City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her General Store and Carinderia (eatery) business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Aurelia is now borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she can continue to purchase more stock to sell.   This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Aurelia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell to customers

loans.name: Lorry

texts.en:
Lorry L. is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 43 years old. Lorry is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Lorry owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snacks in the local community. Lorry has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lorry joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna I. is a 44-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing/fish-vending business. She lives in Brgy. Coro, Dalaguete, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions through her own efforts and with the help of her loans from NWTF. By working hard in her business, Myrna is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 11,200 PHP. 

Myrna is now borrowing 29,000 PHP so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her last loan of 29,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Myrna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

 About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Mr. Uo Rorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Uo R. has been selected the village bank president by the eighteen people who are all borrowing a village bank loan.  They will all use their portion of the loan in various ways to improve their family's living condition in Prey Chheu Teal village, Takeo Province.  

He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice which he sells to support his family, while his wife, Mrs. Kea Bou, weaves silk cloth to sell to support her family too.  Since his wife’s business is going well, he wants to expand it.  To increase the daily income, Mr. Uo R. is requesting a loan to buy more silk. 

Through this activity, the couple supports two kids who are all are too young to work or study in school.

loans.use: To buy more silk.

With the help of his wife, Batbayar operates a consumer goods retail business in his town. They sell a variety of products that have been imported from China. He first started his business in 1997 and stopped in 2000 after purchasing a car.  Since 2000, he has been operating a transportation service between local subprovinces; in 2008 Batbayar returned to his consumer goods business. For the future, they hope to expand their business. Batbayar is a talkative and open-minded man and is planning to continue operating his business so that he can afford to buy a house for his family. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase his working capital for his retail business.

Byambasuren operates a stationary selling business and photo-taking service at a local market in the city. She has been engaged this business since 2007 and has since built a stable operation. Today, her working capital exceeds between 500,000 and 800,000 MNT, and her daily business income has reached 30,000 to 50,000 MNT, with a net profit of 30 to 40 percent. After years of successful operation, Byambasuren has gained a lot of experience and her earnings have enabled her to provide for her family. For the future, she hopes to continue managing her business with sustainable operations. She says, "my goals are to provide higher education for both my children and purchase a fence and house for my family." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to expand her stationary trading business.

loans.use: To expand her stationary trading business

loans.name: Mary Gold

texts.en:
Mary Gold F. is from the village of Port Area, Iligan City. She is 19 years old. Mary Gold is single and has one infant-aged children. To make a living, Mary Gold owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling used clothing, or ukay-ukay, in the local community. Mary Gold has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Gold joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Gold has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Mary Gold is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional used clothing. This will be the second loan taken out by Mary Gold from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional used clothing

location.town: Port Area, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Хочиев Исмоил проживает в районе Вахдат. Ему 35 лет. Женат. Отец троих детей. Образование среднее. Работает на центральном рынке района. Имеет небольшую столовую. Работа приносит доход, который дает возможность обеспечить семью. В этой области уже четыре года. Кредит берет для ремонта столовой. Это поможет ему улучшить качество обслуживания и привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en: Ismoil H. lives in Vahdat.  He is 35 years old, married, and the father of three children.  He has a high school education.  He owns a small café in the area’s central market.  This work provides the income which supports the family.  He has been doing this for four years.  He is taking out a loan to repair the dining room.  This will help him improve the quality of service he offers and to attract new customers.

loans.use: Renovate a cafe

loans.name: Edelina

texts.en:
Edelina P. is from the village of Rogongon, Iligan City. She is 36 years old. Edelina is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Edelina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snack foods in the local community. Edelina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Edelina is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like instant noodles & breads. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Edelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

location.town: Rogongon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Dashdemberel

texts.en:
Dashdemberel D. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in their own aparment. 

Dashdemberel operates a firewood and coal selling business with the help of his wife at a local market in the city. Since 2000, he has been engaged in this business and has built a stable and successful operation over the years. His earnings have enabled him to buy land in 2007 and an apartment in 2010. 

Since operating his business, he has managed to improve his family's standard of living. He obtained loans from banks and has proven himself to be a trustworthy customer who always pays on time and in full. He used the loan to purchase coals from local mines and woods at wholesale price in order to sell them at the local market as a retailer. 

For the future, Dashdemberel says, "I would like to remodel and decorate my apartment. " He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood and coal for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood and coal to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 63-year-old lady, married to Martin, 63, who is a farmer.  They are blessed with four children who are grown ups

Alice has been in this business for a year, whereby she earns Kshs. 6,000 in profit monthly.  The extra cash she gets from her husband's farming  is used to supplement what she gets from the business, thus helping her business to grow.

She  was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. This is her first loan, which she is planning to use to purchase stocks of new clothes worth Kshs 20,000.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita J. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Margarita is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Margarita owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coco lumber in variety of sizes in the local community. Margarita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Margarita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Margarita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coco lumber to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Margarita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coco lumber to sell

loans.name: Nyamdorj

texts.en:
Nyamdorj L. is a 49-year-old and lives with his wife and daughter in Hovd province, Mongolia. The family lives together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter, age 6, attends a local primary school while his wife works as an accountant for the university and during her free time, helps Nyamdorj by preparing financial reports for his business.

 Nyamdorj owns and operates a tailoring factory called " Buteelch Zuu" (meaning Productive Needle) which was started in 2010. Before he began his current business, he used to operate two kinds of businesses including raw materials and flour trading businesses and has gained much experience as a businessman.

 For the future, he hopes to expand his business and remodel both his workplace and house using his future business earnings. With his loan, he is planning to purchase a large amount of materials and supplies in order to meet the high demand for upcoming Mongolian and European New Year holidays. 

Nyamdorj is a very modest man. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing fabrics and materials for his growing business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing fabrics and materials

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron K. is 43 years old and a resident of Saos Trading Centre in Koibatek town. He is married with eight children. His spouse is Jane, an horticultural farmer. They both support their family. Haron buys and resells livestock as a source of income, and from this business he gets an average profit of Kshs 5,000 a month.
 
Haron has borrowed a third  loan of Kshs 30,000 from Kadet after successfully paying off the second loan. He intends to use Kshs. 10,000 to purchase 10 goats and Kshs. 20,000 to buy young steers for resale later when they are grown.
 
Haron plans to use the anticipated profits to buy more cattle. His hopes and dreams are to become a cattle supplier to  Kenya Meat Commission and also be able to give his children the best education possible.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma G. is from the village of Digkilaan, Iligan City. She is 27 years old. Emma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling AVON & NATASHA products in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory from AVON & NATASHA. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory from AVON & NATASHA

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine A. is from the village of Santa Felomena, Iligan City. She is 30 years old. Christine is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Christine owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling dried fish like "pinikas & tamban" in the local community. Christine has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Christine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Christine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Christine is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional dried fish such as  "sapsap & bolinaw". This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Christine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ulanbayar

texts.en:
Ulanbayar T. is a 24-year-old single lady who lives with her parents and two siblings in their own house and fence in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her parents operate a grocery and consumer goods mobile trading business. Ulanbayar operates a hair salon out of a rented space at the local trade center. She graduated from a hairdressing school in 2005 and since 2006, she has been working as a hairdresser. 

After years of stable operation, she was able to purchase a car for herself. For the future, she plans to purchase necessary tools and equipment for her beauty shop and decorate her working place after obtaining loan from the Bank. She is a very clever, intelligent and hard-working woman, and says, "For the upcoming New Year holiday, I plan to buy more hairdressing tools for my beauty shop and decorate my workplace so I can provide good service to my customers in a comfortable environment."  She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to replace the styling tools and equipment used in her hair salon and remodel her salon.

loans.use: To replace her styling tools and equipment

loans.name: Kyaterekera Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
30-year-old N. Agnes has been plying her poultry and pig husbandry businesses in Lusera-Mukono for close to 3 years now. She says inspiration from a close friend was the motivating factor that got her started. Agnes says hard work, tenacity and steadfastness have been worthwhile stock in trade for her as her business makes progress. 

Agnes is married with 2 children aged 9 and 4. They both attend school in Mukono town. Weekly her poultry sales business generates shillings 150,000 and she says with this loan, she is going to purchase more  chicken feed or mash for her chickens.  She belongs to Kyaterekera Development Group.

loans.use: The purchase of more chicken feed for her chickens

loans.name: Florebelle

texts.en:
Florebelle B. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 24 years old. Florebelle is separated from her spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Florebelle owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling animal feed & farm-related products in the local community. Florebelle has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Florebelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florebelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Florebelle is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional feed products. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Florebelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed products

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en:
Mendbayar L. is a 40-year-old single mother who lives with her two children in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her son live together in a 'ger', which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her older child, a daughter, is a university student and her son currently attends a local secondary school. 

Mendbayar operates a meat trading business in her town. She started her business in 2003 after living and working as a herder in the countryside till 1990. Her business is very important both for her and her family because it is the only source of her family income. In addition, she plants and grows vegetables in their 5 hectare field. 

For the future, Mendbayar hopes to expand her business. She is a talkative and open-minded woman and her dream is to open her own grocery shop in her yard. Mendbayar is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat at wholesale prices and sell it as a retailer.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia N. is a widow who lives in Lapu lapu St., Brgy. Mandaragat, Puerto Princesa City, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  Buying and selling dry goods and buying and selling fruit. She has three children who are 32 to 45 years old, with two of them having their own families while her other child is working to help her. 

Verginia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Verginia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 30,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th loan, she is once again borrowing PHP 29,500 which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future and for emergencies. 

Verginia N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida P. is 31 years old, married, and supports her family by operating 3 business ventures:  a sari-sari (general) store,  an electronic reloading business, and a tricycle business. She lives in Prk. Abanico, Brgy. San Pedro, Puerto Princesa City, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her Sari-sari (general) store, electronic reloading and tricycle businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12000. Zenaida is now borrowing PHP 10000 so that she could purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 28000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Zenaida aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna S. is from the village of Santa Felomena, Iligan City. She is 52 years old. Myrna is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, detergents, canned goods & snack foods in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 4000, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like snack foods & beverages. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng B., 38 years old, is a humble villager living in the province of Kompong Chhnang. Chheng B. makes his living by working in the construction field as a building worker and has a proper salary every month. He has been married for many years but he doesn’t have any children yet.  His wife is a seller.  

From most of the products which Chheng B.’s wife sells such as soft drink and fast food, she can earn an income of approximately $2 per day. Currently, Chheng B.’s wife hopes to enlarge her business by purchasing more pessary items to sell to earn extra revenue. To encourage his wife’s business, Chheng B. will use his loan for his wife to purchase more fast food and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: To purchase food and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn B. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Sillom, Bantayan, Cebu City. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  pig fattening and fishing. Her husband, Gualberto Bawiin, who is 46 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living.  He also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 7 children who are a few days old to 21 years old. 

Marilyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 19th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and for their family's needs. 

Marilyn B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: To fund business operations

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old engaged man from Lebanon.  He lives on his own. He has been working as a taxi driver since 2005. His main service route is between his town and its surroundings. He also takes private transportation such as picnic, traveling etc.  He works hard to earn a profit because he helps his family with the expenses. They live near his house and he is the one who takes care of them. Today he is requesting $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform much needed maintenance work on his taxi’s engine and body and to obtain the proper legA. clearance for his vehicle. In the future, he is hopes to purchase a new car so that he can continue to expand his business. He feels positive about his business growth for the coming year.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his taxi’s engine and body and to obtain legal clearance for his vehicle

loans.name: Mrs. Norng Sambou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has fifteen members in Khnar Rung village, Takeo province. All the members have selected Mrs. Norng S. to become the village bank president. They will use their portion of this loan for different purposes to improve their family with this fund.

Mrs. Norng S. and her husband are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow rice and vegetable to sell to support their family.  She is also a pig breeder. She is concerned that her income is very low, as her business has recently suffered due to insufficient financial capital. So to improve her pig breeding business, Mrs. Norng S. is applying for a loan to have more funds to buy more piglets which will allow her to improve her profits.  With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy fertilizer to support her crops in the field. 

She is a mother of four children, two of whom are employed in garment factories while the others are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Mburu

texts.en:
Mburu is 56 years old and married to Mukami Mburu. He has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 20 years. He is also a dairy farmer on the side. He was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by one of our credit officers and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 26,000 KES well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow for milk production.
In the future, Mburu hopes to practise large-scale farming and be a leading producer of farm produce in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Lundaa

texts.en:
Lundaa H. is 68 years old and lives with his wife and adult son in the province of Hovd, Mongolia. He and his family live in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. His son, age 19, currently attends university while both he and his wife are retired.  He is a talkative and open-minded person.  

Since 2006, Lundaa has been operating a business selling pure water. After working for the social insurance department of his province between 1996 and 2002, he started his own business in 2002, operating a grocery shop called "Guchingiin Gol", which he gave to his son-in-law in 2008.  In the future, he plans to expand his current business to the production of concrete blocks using well water. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to renovate the equipment for his water-selling business and purchase the necessary equipment and tools for starting his concrete business.

loans.use: to start a business producing concrete blocks from well water

loans.name: Jemalyn

texts.en:
Jemalyn R. is from the village of Barinaut, near Iligan City. She is 20 years old and married. To make a living, Jemalyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, detergents & junk food in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jemalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like junk food. This will be Jemalyn’s 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.	

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like junk food

location.town: Barina-ut, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita G. is a hardworking mother who sells fish to earn a living. She has been in this business for ten years, providing a valuable service to people in her village. 

She belongs to a group of active entrepreneurs who have saved money and secured capital from ASHI, a Kiva field partner. She’s grateful that the organization has helped her improve her fish selling business, bettering her quality of living and lifting her out of poverty. 

Lolita has requested a new loan of 35,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to increase her inventory of fish in the future so she can sell more. She sees herself venturing into the wholesale business in the next three years, and hopes that this shift will help her to support her three children financially so that they are able to graduate from college and find better employment someday. By then, Lolita thinks their lives will be changed and she will have her dreams fulfilled.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida L. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Kaungkod, Madredijos, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: pig fattening and a frozen foods business. Her husband, Bernardo L., who is 50 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's businesses. They have four children aged between 15 and 26.
Nida joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past ten loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nida has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 22,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 3,000 PHP, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing 29,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase feed and other supplies for her piggery. In this way, she hopes to continue to save up for the future and to sustain their daily needs and give their children a good education.
Nida L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase feed and other piggery supplies

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn M. is from the village of Port Area, Iligan City. She is 29 years old, single and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a furniture-making business. The main source of income for the business comes from making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. This will be Jocelyn’s 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings

location.town: Port Area, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man and the father of four school-age children. He has been working in flooring for the past nine years. And in 2008, he started taking on private projects. He works hard to raise his four children and to satisfy their needs. He works on a freelance basis at the request of the clients. Today he is requesting $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a polishing machine and paving cutter to be able to take on more projects and increase his business income. His income is vital because he is the main income provider of the family. He hopes that with the new machines his business will grow and he will have the opportunity to work closely with construction entrepreneurs concerning flooring.

loans.use: To purchase a polishing machine and paving cutter

loans.name: Mrs. Nou Samai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 16 people located in Khnar Rung village, Takeo province. The group has selected Mrs. Nou S. as village bank president. The group members will use their portions of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their family's standard of living.
Mrs. Nou S. is a mother of two children who both attend public school. She and her husband, Mr. Ra Ben, are farmers who own a half-hectare plot of land to grow rice, watermelon and cucumber to sell to support their family. Nou S. also breeds chickens. Now it is time to grow crops, but her income is small as her business has recently suffered due to insufficient capital. To improve production, Mrs. Nou S. is asking for a loan to buy watermelon seed, cucumber seed and rice. With the rest of the loan she is going to buy more chicken and chicken food.

loans.use: To buy watermelon seed, cucumber seed and rice

loans.name: Dau's Group

texts.en:
Dau T. N. is 47 years old. She lives in Xuan Trach village, Xuan Canh commune. She has two children. She sells goods in the market. She has this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 2.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 2.204.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 4.142.000 VND to small business.
  About other borrowers in her group:
  Ha T. D. is 46 years old. She raises chicken. She would like to borrow 6.322.000 VND to buy food for chicken.
  Soi T. N. is 48 years old. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to breed the pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to small business

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
A tough woman, hardworking, and a good mother of five children -- these characteristics describe Zenaida M., a 48-year-old woman. She is married to Elfelio, 52 years old, and works closely with him as a fisherman. The couple continues living and working hard for their five children. They are now living with them.

In 1999, Zenaida joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in generating-income activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI. 

She is requesting a new loan of 33,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fishing nets, fish cages (fish traps), and continue to expand her business.  Zenaida plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her venture. 

With the chance given to her family by KIVA partner, Zenaida believes that they are getting nearer to the success of their family's dreams. 

Zenaida’s dreams are for her 5 children to have decent living, out of poverty.  Additionally, she hopes that through her determination, her business will reach it success.

loans.use: To buy fishing net & fish traps, and expand fishing business.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana D. is a married woman who lives in Cordova, Brgy. Cogon, Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a business venture: a vegetable vending  business.  Her husband Wensislao D., who is 47 years old, helps his wife in running the business. They have 5 children who are 7 to 23 years old. 

Luciana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Luciana has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 3rd cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for the future and expand her business.  Luciana D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Tajiri Ene

texts.en:
Tajiri Ene has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last four years.  She is 25 years old, married to Musa Kshao, and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy 10 goats, which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Tajiri hopes to start selling curios, targeting tourists who frequently visit Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy 10 goats to rear and sell

loans.name: Inda

texts.en:
Inda I. is a married woman who lives in Tagdalungon, Brgy. Rio-Tuba, Bataraza, Palawan. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  dried fish selling and food vending.  Her husband Abdurahman I., who is 57 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 6 children who are 10 to 25 years old. 

Inda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Inda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for food processing so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and the education of her children. Inda I. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Mrs. Nhoeb Bopha Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people are made up this village bank loan in Khnar Rung village, Takeo province. They have selected Mrs. Nhoeb B. to become the village bank president for this loan.  The members will use their portion of the loan for their own purposes to improve their family's living. 

Mrs. Nhoeb B. is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Touch Meas, is a palm juice collector who earns some money from selling palm sugar to support his family.  He is also a construction worker.  

Mrs. Nhoeb B. has some problems because her husband does not have enough supplies to use for collecting palm juice. So Mrs. Nhoeb B. is applying for a loan to buy those supplies.  With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy piglets for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of three children who are studying in school.

loans.use: To buy supplies for collecting palm juice

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, 36 years old, has a very supportive and responsible husband, Glecerio, who is now 41 years old. Her husband is a fisherman.  One source of their income comes from fishing.  Her husband works as a fisherman but this only gives them a small income.  Her husband works hard all day catching fish in the ocean, but he brings home a very small amount of money because the ones who own the fishing equipment get a larger amount, and they will only give him a small percent.

So Agnes decided to request loan again with Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) to buy fishing equipment so that the revenue will be only for them. She will used the loan to buy fishing cages (fish traps), fishing nets, and other things that are needed in her fishing business. She will help her husband sell the fish that he will catch in the sea. 

She decided to set up this business in order to increase their daily income and sustain their needs, like everyday expenses and the education of her five children: Christine Joy - 17 years old, Crister - 14 years old, Jess - 9 years old, John - 7 years old, and Roman - 4 years old. 

Agnes is very happy to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for offering financial support for her business dreams.

loans.use: To buy fish cages/traps, nets, and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Pav

texts.en:
Pav S. is 39 years old and lives Battambang Province. Pav S. earns his living by teaching children who are learning in school. He has been working in this sector since 1999 and gets a formal salary every month.  He has a life partner in his wife, who is a seller.  She sells items like soft drinks, sweets for kids, and some cooking supplies. This couple is blessed with two kids, who are single and living under their care. 

Pav S.’s wife is doing well in her business because she has good communication with her customers and she sells her products at reasonable prices.   Pav S. wishes to support his wife’s business, and would like to request some funds from Kiva in order for his wife to purchase soft drinks, sweets, and other necessary items for selling. 

Pav S. was not available on the day of photo taking, so his wife is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, sweets, and other items to sell

loans.name: Tenocra

Tenocra Y. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Malis, Brooke's Point, Palawan.  She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and a copra business.  Her husband Alvin Y., who is 31 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have one child who is 1 year old. 

Tenocra joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Tenocra has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus increasing the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 which she intends to use to buy stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her child and improve her businesses.  Tenocra Y. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

Paul is 30 years old and single. For the last six years, he has been farming in Ndunyu Njeru town.

In the future, Paul hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is a 41-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures. She sells eggs and food, and she also drives a pedicab. She lives in Brgy. Cogon, Cordova, Cebu City. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 9,000 PHP. Elizabeth is now borrowing 11,000 PHP so that she can purchase additional inventory to sell. This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elizabeth aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.
