loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada R. lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. Her husband works long hours as a fisherman to support the family. 

To supply additional income, Iluminada would like to receive a loan of 22,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase raw materials needed in her fishing business, such as fishing net, and for maintenance of their fishing boat. With more fish to catch and sell, she believes that sales will increase, leading to higher revenue. 
 
As a dedicated member of Kiva partner ASHI, she ensured strong performance with regular attendance in group meetings and steady repayments. Iluminada is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her business dreams. 

With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her business will continue to flourish to improve the family’s quality of life and fund all of her children’s education until they finish college.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed in her fishing business, such as fishing net, and for maintenance of their fishing boat.

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien T. D. is 28 years old. She lives in Luc Canh village, Xuan Canh commune. She is married with two children. She has a small shop where she sells drinks,confectionery, tobacco and other items. She has been doing this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. 

Tien T. D. has participated in SEDA since 2008, getting loans to invest in her shop and repaying punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8.066.000 VND to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba H. is a married woman who lives in Tagdalungon, Brgy. Rio Tuba, Bataraza, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a dried fish sales business. Her husband, Haji Mahmod, who is 40 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children aged between 11 and 26.

Habiba joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and her own efforts, Habiba has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 9th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for her business. She intends to sell her dried fish at the central market and continue to save up for her children's future education. Habiba H. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team. "

loans.use: additional capital for the business

loans.name: Bethuel Murimi

texts.en:
Bethuel has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last four years. He is 47 years old and married to Elizabeth Wangui. They have three school-going children.

Bethuel was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan. He paid his previous loan of KES 70,000 in full and in good time. He plans to use this loan amount for land preparation and to buy seedlings, fertilizers and a calf. In the future, Bethuel hopes to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: land preparation and to buy seedlings, fertilizers and a calf

loans.name: Toan

texts.en: Toan T. N. is 33 years old and married with two children. They live in Luc Canh, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She has a small shop in the market selling rice. She has had this job for many years. Her monthly income is about 3,000,0000 dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy more rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Jane Muthoni

texts.en: Jane has operated her cereals shop in Njabini for the last 16 years. She is 41 years old and has five children. Jane was introduced to KADET by one of her friends and this will be her second loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more cereals to sell in her store. In the future, Jane hopes to expand her grocery store and sell different types of food.

loans.use: to buy more cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Savoeun K., 42, and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Sen, 48, have been married since 1990 and have 8 children - 5 sons and 3 daughters. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Savoeun is a farmer; he grows ginger and other vegetables on his farmland in the village where he lives. His wife sells vegetables. He is asking for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru: Кулиева Мария проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 53 года. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Муж вместе с двумя сыновьями находится на заработках в России. Сама Мария имеет среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается торговлей. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Она покупает недорого бычков и продает по более выгодной цене. В этом ей помогает сын. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота. Таким образом, Мария хочет увеличить их количества и улучшить финансовое положение в семье.
texts.en: Mariya K. lives in Yavan.  She is 53 years old, married, and has six children.  Her husband and two sons work in Russia. Maria has a high school education.  She has been working in sales for more than ten years.  She makes a living selling cattle.  She buys calves cheaply and resells for a profit.  Her son helps her.   She is taking out a loan to buy cattle.  Maria wants to expand her herd and thereby improve her family’s finances.

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Kibande

texts.en:
V. Kibande is a young single man of 22 years old. He has no children and lives alone in Lumakanda in the outskirts of Eldoret. He has a retail shop as a primary business and also has a cereals shop in the same area. He has been in business for two years now and he earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This will be V.'s first loan from KADET LTD and he will use it to add stock to his shop. He will buy perishable commodities such as bread and milk as well as cereals such as maize and beans. In the future, he hopes to go back to school and attain a degree certificate and also expand his retail business.

loans.use: to add stock such as bread, eggs and milk and to buy cereals

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is an example of a strong woman who can thrive and make a living for her family. A 42-year-old mother of four (Razel, Larry, Raquel and John Paul), she lives in Antipolo, Rizal in the Philippines. 

Liza’s main goal is to build a sustainable business to meet the needs of her family; she was thus encouraged to join ASHI, the first KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 1999. The previous loans she received from ASHI were carefully invested in her sari-sari (variety) store. Since then, her business has been performing well and earning her sufficient profit. 

Liza needs working capital to help boost her business for increased profit making. She is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP as additional capital for her variety store, to be used to pay for groceries for her enterprise. 

Liza is optimistic that she can achieve her dreams of providing a good life for her family. Her long term-goal is for her 4 children to finish their studies until they complete their college degrees. She hopes that these dreams will come true and that ASHI will give the best direction and opportunity to her family. Liza is very happy to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for offering financial support to her business dreams.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana A. is 45 years old, married and supports her family by operating a Ready to Wear (RTW) business. She lives in Bagumbayan 2, Brgy. Maribago, Cordova, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Ready to Wear (RTW) business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 11,000. Feliciana is now borrowing PHP 6,500 to fund her operations. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 4,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Feliciana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: Funds in business operations

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Habil  Gilbert

texts.en:
Habil Gilbert A. is a man of 43 who is married to Halima and has nine children. He buys music discs and tapes in bulk and sells them in small quantities to his customers. He has been in this business for 20 years and he gets a monthly income of 10,000 shillings.


This will be Habil's fourth loan from KADET. He will buy music discs and tapes. Since it is the month of December, his sales will increase. With the income he is going to get, he plans to own a music shop in the future. 


In future, Habil wants to educate his children to university level and also provide them with basic needs like food, shelter and good clothing.

loans.use: To add more stock of Music Discs and Tapes

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with two children, all of whom are still too young for school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business for the past two years. In addition he also operates a cafe which contributes to his other source of income. His potential customers are neighbours and travelers. Ali faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand his business in the future. 

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With the Kshs 40,000, he wants to start a poultry business and purchase a brood of chickens.

loans.use: To start a poultry business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma G. is a 58-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  fruit vending and buying & selling of copra. She lives in Prk. Linao, Brgy. Ipilan, Brookes Point, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 37712 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.   By working hard in her fruit vending and buying & selling of Copra businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000.  

Emma  is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her banana and copra business.  This will be her 22nd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Emma  aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund operations of banana & copra business

loans.name: Selma

texts.en:
Selma V. is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating one business venture: buying & selling bananas.  She lives in Brgy. Ipilan, Brookes Point, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her buying & selling of fruits business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000.  

Selma is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her fruit vending business.   This will be her 23rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Selma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund fruit vending business

loans.name: Sikoe Ole

texts.en:
Sikoe Ole N. is 36 years old. He is married to Naropill N. and is a father of eight school-going children. 

Sikoe is a farmer and has been farming his own piece of land for the last ten years.

He learnt about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan. He is planning to do spend forty thousands to prepare the land for the next planting season and spend the remaining ten thousand to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his maize plantation. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease more land for farming to increase his maize output and use some part of the profit to develop his own plot.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant more maize in large scale.  Sikoe believes he is hardworking and with the right resources at his disposal, he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To prepare land for planting, and buy chemicals & fertilizer

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokun C. and her husband, Mr. Ny Khin, have been married since 1982 and have seven children:  five sons and two daughters. The family lives on an Island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokun is a weaver.  Her husband is a fisherman.  In addition, he is a farmer as well.  Sokun is requesting a loan of US $300 to provide capital for her husband's farming. He will use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to maintain his farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides for farming

loans.name: Patrick Karanja

texts.en:
Patrick has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 34 years.  He is 60 years old, married to Teresia Wairimu.

He heard about KADET from one of our field staff and this will be his second loan.  He paid his first loan of Kshs 35,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer, and to pay for labour during planting season.

In the future, Patrick hopes to have a big farm, raising both crops and animals.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings & fertilizers, and pay for labour for planting

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy N. is 47 years old and her husband, Mr. Sophal Morn, is 50 years old.  They live along national road number one, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1982 and have seven children:  two sons and five daughters. Three of them are married, one is a security guard, one is a monk, and the other two attend school.

Savy and her husband have been growing rice and fishing since they married. Savy is asking for her first loan of $400 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice farm. 

Photo: Mrs. Savy N. and her husband were at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, pesticide for farming

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of 3 young children. He is the main income provider for his family. He has twelve years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 2000. He cultivates all types of vegetables according to the season. He uses plastic tents to grow his products. These tents also allow him to better monitor product quality as well as grow his products for more months during the year. He works independently in his business. Today, he is requesting a loan of $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: To purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice N. is a 29-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: school supplies vending, rags vending, and a general store business. She lives in Cordova, Brgy. San Miguel, Lapu-lapu City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her school supplies, rags vending, and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP30,000.  

Janice is now borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Janice aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund business operations

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bernard Ogandi

texts.en:
Bernard has practiced dairy farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 38 years old, married to Violet Ogandi, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 3rd loan.  He paid for all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, Bernard hopes to establish himself in selling dairy products.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mr. Pon C. (pictured with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Ky Phon, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1975 and have five children. Three of the children are married and live outside the family home, one is a security guard, and one is a farmer. The couple is old, however they are still strong enough to work. 

Pon has been selling cows for 35 years.  He learned the business from his father. He buys cows from other villages and resell to customers who come to buy them at his home. His wife runs a grocery store in front of her house and is also a farmer.
  
Pon had asked for a Kiva loan once before, he now is requesting another loan of $1,200 USD to purchase additional cows for resale and to help his wife expand her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale, and expand grocery store

loans.name: Samuel King'ori

texts.en:
Samuel has practiced dairy farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 35 years old, married to Sarah Wambui and they have four children.

He heard about KADET from one of our credit officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid for his first loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, Samuel hopes to buy a bigger farm and practice dairy farming on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mr. Sarin Y. (shown in the photo) is 30 years old and his wife, Mrs. Chanthy Un, is 27 years old. They live in a small village on National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2005 and have three sons.

Mr. Sarin Y. is a barber. His wife stays at home and does housework. He is asking for his first loan of $200 to repair the house where he lives.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en: Oyun P. is a single mother who lives with her two children and grandchild in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She and her children live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son attends a vocational training school and her oldest daughter stays at home taking care of her two-year-old child. Oyun operates a vegetable retail business in her town. Since 2008, she has been selling a variety of vegetables, which she plants and grows in her own field. Her two children both help Oyun with her business. She would like to purchase grocery products such as pickled salad, cucumber, mayonnaise etc in order to sell those products along with her vegetables. Oyun is a hardworking woman. She says, "All I want is to provide a higher education for my two children so that they can take care of me for my rest of the life." Oyun is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more vegetables for her grocery trading business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Mielin

texts.en:
Mielin G. is a married woman who lives in Cordova, Brgy. Cogon, Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband, Garry G., is 33 years old and works as a security guard. They have 1 child who is 9 years old. 

Mielin joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mielin has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 7,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 20,000 PHP, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 8th cycle loan, she is borrowing 12,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her business. 

Mielin G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sonak

texts.en:
Mrs. Sonak S. (in the photo with her loom) is a weaver. Her husband, Mr. Phoun Choun is also a weaver. The couple have been married since 2001 and have three children. Two of the children are in school and one is still too young to attend school. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

The weaving business is a traditional profession and Sonak wants to continue in this tradition. So Sonak is asking for her third loan of $100 to purchase weaving materials in order to continue her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita P. is a 56-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a fish selling business. She lives in Salvacion St., Poblacion District II, Brookes Point, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions through her own efforts and with the help of her loans from NWTF.  By working hard in her fish selling business, Lolita is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 13,000 PHP.  

Lolita is now borrowing 29,500 PHP so that she can continue to fund her fish vending operations. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 28,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lolita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her fish vending business

loans.name: Polly

texts.en:
Polly is 21 years old and single. She works as a front office assistant at Early Bird Academy. She also operates a motorcycle transport business, which is locally known as "boda boda". Polly has employed a motorbike rider to operate the business. Polly has been in this business for the last two years and hence, acquired the relevant skills.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, and intends to buy another motorbike. Her salary will be used to take care of food and other basic needs. She is hopeful to succeed and grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhun S. is a 38-year-old married woman and a local villager living in the Kompong Cham Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. She planted rice and vegetable crops on her land in order to earn income to support her family’s expenses. Her husband also assists her in farming business. This family makes an average profit of $2.50 per day. They have three children, who are all single. 

Mrs. Chhun S. would like a loan in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business. Mrs. Chhun S. will rent out this land to farmers for a fee. Mrs. Chhun S. was not available on the day of the photograph, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land for a farming business.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarom S. and her husband, Mr. Onn Ngoun, have been married since 1994 and have two children: one son and one daughter. The family lives along National Road Number Six, approximately 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sarom just started a business growing rice and lotus. Her husband is a fisherman and assists his wife in the farming business as well. 

Sarom had asked for a Kiva loan once before, she now is asking for her second loan of $800 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice and lotus farm. She will also use part of the loan to purchase fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides for farm, and nets for fishing business

loans.name: Jane Wambui

texts.en:
Jane has been operating a boutique shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eight years.  She is a 47-year-old lady married to David G. Kamau. They have seven children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to boost her boutique shop stock and also buy a dairy cow. 

In the future she hopes to expand her boutique business and be able to import clothes from other countries.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes in her boutique, and buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kikongo Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
34-year-old  K. Moses has been operating an alcohol selling business in Kikongo-Mukono for 10 years. It is a business that appeals to both low and middle income earners in and around his neighborhood. 

Moses says he began this business with the sway of his mother. Before that he was more inclined toward a maize flour selling enterprise. 

Moses, who is happily married with 4 kids, says hard work, determination and prayers are what he has relied on to firmly establish his niche.  With this loan, Moses, who is affliated with Kikongo Development group, says he is going to purchase more bottles of alcohol to resell.

loans.use: The purchase alcohol to resell

loans.name: Ne

texts.en:
Mr. Ne L. is 23 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sopha Phal, is 20 years old.  They have been married since 2008 and have one young daughter. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  

Mr. Ne L. produces chairs and vases made of cement. His wife assists her husband in the business. 

Ne hopes to expand his business and to respond to his customer’s needs. So, he is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to use for that purpose.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en:
Oyungerel N. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and son in Hovd province in Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son is 49 years old and is currently enlisted in the 123th squad of the Mongolian military. 

Oyungerel and her husband own and operate a shoe repair business. She began her shoe repair service in 2005 after working as a shoe maker in a local company between 1981 and 1993. For the future, she hopes to build a house in her yard from her business profits.  

She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to buy more repair supplies and tools for her shoe repair business and to purchase livestock to sell retail as meat after slaughtering them during the upcoming spring months.

loans.use: To buy supplies and tools for shoe repair business, and livestock for meat business

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom C. is 47 years old and her husband, Mr. Sophal Pheng, is 51 years old.  They have been married since 1979 and have seven children:  two sons and five daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home, three are in school, one is a garment factory worker, and one is a motorbike repairman. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Mr. Sophal Pheng is a mechanic. 

The main source of income is from her daughter and husband’s salaries. Sreymom stays at home and does housework. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to ride to school.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle for children to ride to school

loans.name: Elizabeth Wambui

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been selling clothes in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. She is a 52-year-old married lady.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her fourth loan. She paid her previous loan of Kshs 35,000 in full and in good time. She plans to use this loan to boost her boutique shop stock by buying new clothes for sale during the festive season, and also to engage in horticultural farming.

In the future, she hopes to expand her boutique business and also adopt modern methods of farming, e.g., using green houses.

loans.use: To stock clothes for sale, and start horticultural farming

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Mr. B. Hem and his wife, Mrs. Kimsan Ny, have been married since 1996 and have two daughters. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Mr. B. Hem and his wife have been selling fish for more than four years. They buy fish from fishermen and transport them to sell in the local market. In addition, they also grow lotus. 

B. had asked for a Kiva loan once before, he now is requesting his second loan of $700 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his lotus farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticide for lotus farm

loans.name: Ronkosi

texts.en:
Ronkosi O. K. is 60 years old. He is married to Melissa K. and is a father of ten school-going children. Ronkosi is a businessman involved in selling young bulls to the businessmen who are willing to fatten them and sell later at a profit.  He has been in this business for the past 20 years and is doing well.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he plans to spend on purchasing more cows to increase the number of young bulls for selling. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease land for farming.
 
His future dream is that he will be a commercial businessman and a renowned one. Despite his age Ronkosi believes he is hard working and he will achieve his set target.

loans.use: To buy young bulls for reselling

loans.name: Kabul Nawin Group

texts.en:
Raziya is a member of Kabul Nawin group. She is married and lives in a big family.

Raziya’s husband has a vehicle repair workshop and he can repair all kinds of vehicles in his workshop.  Nevertheless, his monthly income is too small and not enough for the necessities of his family.  That is why he requested a loan to build up his business and increase his monthly income.  He hopes that after the loan, he will have a comfortable life with his family.

loans.use: To build up vehicle repair business

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man with two children who are too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

He operates a mobile phone accessories shop. Passersby and neighbors are his potential customers. David faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand and operate as a wholesale business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase mobile phone accessories and electrical chargers. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone accessories and electrical chargers.

loans.name: Keneth

texts.en:
Kenneth C. is 26 years old and married to Angelina Aiyabei who is a housewife. They have four children between 6 years and 2 years of age. Kenneth runs a hotel in Kabarnet town and he started this business two years ago. He gets a profit of Kshs 8,000 a month from this business.

He has borrowed a second loan of Kshs 21,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, carrots, cabbages, onions and other ingredients needed for preparing food in his hotel. He anticipates using the profits from the business to expand the business and open another hotel in a different location within Kabarnet town.

Kenneth's hope and dream is to have a big restaurant in the future and be able to give the best education to his children.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Han

texts.en: Han P. is a married woman and a good mother blessed with three children. All three of them are single and one of them works as a worker in and around her community. Han P. and her husband cultivate a rice crop on their farm, which came from their grandparent.  Essential income in Han P.’s family comes from her kid who works in the construction field but he currently faces difficulties in traveling to his workplace. He always travels to work by hiring a taxi because he doesn't have his own vehicle. To solve the problem, Han P. has requested a loan to be used for her kid to buy a used motorcycle to drive to his workplace.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle for her son

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet M. is 53 years old. She is from Ngiya in Siaya County. She is married to John and they have eight children who are all over 18 years old.

Janet has a grocery store that she is running in the open-air market in Ngiya. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully completing the first one. Janet wants to use the money to buy more groceries like vegetables, tomatoes, onions etc to add to her stock. She makes a monthly income of Kshs 18,000 with which she plans to top up to the loan amount to be able to add enough stock in her shop. The profits made from her business will be used to cater to the family's needs and expand her business.

Her desire is to be able to diversify into selling second hand clothes.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, tomatoes and onions to add to her stock

loans.name: Reut Ole

texts.en:
Reut Ole K. is 24 years old. He is married to Mary K. and he is the father of two children aged three and one years old, respectively.
Reut is a businessman who is involved in selling animals. He has been doing this for the last four years in Narok town. He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a Kadet registered client. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to use to buy more young bulls to raise and sell later after fattening. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire land for farming to meet the high demand for tomatoes in his area.

His hopes and dreams are to become a great businessman and have his own farm machinery.

Reut is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To buy more young bulls to fatten and sell

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick O. is 24 years old and from the Obunga area in Kisumu. He is married to Eunice who runs a small business in the estate. They have two children- Evans, 7 years old and Carolyne, 1 year old.

Fredrick has a motorcycle, which he uses to ferry goods and people from one area to another. This has been his business for the past five years. He is currently applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, to buy spare parts for the motorbike and also to enable him to open up a retail shop to run alongside the transport business. 

His main desire is to see his business expand and increase his profits to able him cater to his family's needs.

loans.use: Buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Janephar

texts.en:
Janephar K. is 35 years old. She is married to Evans and is a mother of four school-aged children. She is a farmer and has her own piece of land, which she has been working for the past six years.

She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group in her area of residence. This will be her second loan. She is planning to buy fertilizer and chemicals for maize planting. Maize has been doing well in her area due to good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the profits from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Janephar’s dream is to practice large-scale farming and attain financial independence. She is a hard-working woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chemicals for maize planting

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase general store items

loans.name: Patrick Mburu

texts.en:
Patrick, 28 years old, has practiced potato farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years, since the climatic conditions have been very favorable for potatoes. He sells his produce to brokers who later sell at the main market.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend. This will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and pay labor costs.

In the future, Patrick hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Josephine Wamaitha

texts.en:
Josephine has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 30 years.  She is 49 years old and is married to Joseph M.. They have five children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend. This will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer, potato seedlings and pay for labor.

In the future, Josephine hopes to buy more land so that she can practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, potato seedlings and pay for labor

loans.name: Phina

texts.en: Phina S. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  Phina has a business charcoal selling.  She has been in this business for eight years and she works 7 days out of every week.  Phina sells her products from home at wholesale and retail.  Phina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenge(s) for Phina include the rainy season and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to start selling at wholesale only.   Phina lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Jone

texts.en:
Jone is a 39-year-old man married to Faith who is a housewife. They are blessed with three children who are 15,12 and 13 years old.

Jone has been in the hawking business for six years. He manages to earn Ksh 15,000 per month. He has been in the business long enough to make him identify fast-moving goods and potential clients. He plans to use his profits to educate his children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To purchase hawking items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary T. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school.  Mary has a retail shop. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week.  Mary sells her products in a shop at retail. Mary has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jericans of cooking oil. The main business challenge(s) for Mary include transportation and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to start selling at wholesale only.   Mary lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Jonifa

texts.en:
Jonifa is 52 years old and married to Caleb, who is a driver. They are blessed with four children ages 27, 24, 20 and 17. Jonifa has been in the cloth-selling business for five years, thus being able to identify her potential clients.

Her husband is able to cover most of their expenses, while she concentrates on her business. The monthly income from her business is 30,000 KES.

This is her fourth loan from KADET. Successfully repaying her previous loans is a clear indication that she is doing well. She hopes one day to own a boutique.

loans.use: Purchase of cloth for sale.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 34 years old. He is married to Juliana who is 28 years and a tailor. They are blessed with one child, 6 years old. Michael is a shoe seller and he has been in this business for 12 years with a monthly income of 12,000 KES. His wife assists him in meeting their family’s expenses and he is happy about that.

Friends introduced Michael to KADET LTD. This is his first loan. He plans to use 4,000 KES in expansion of his shoes business to another town. He will use 11,000 KES to stock his current business with things like shoe soles, brushes, polish, and gum.

In the future, Michael would like to own a big wholesale shop for shoes.

loans.use: Part of it will go to expansion of current business stock, while the rest will be invested in a new business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more consignment of medicine (drugs)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Mutangu

texts.en:
Mutangu is a 44 year-old man who is married to Mbula, who is a 40 year-old housewife. They are blessed with 2 children. Mutangu sells tomatoes in an open-air market in Emali town. He has been in this business for 20 years, and has been able to get very loyal clients, thus being able to make 15,000 KES as his monthly profit. 

Friends introduced him to KADET LTD. This is his first loan. He plans to use this loan to restock his business with more tomatoes. The anticipated profits will be used to expand the business. Mutangu hopes to become self-sustainable in his business.

loans.use: To restock his tomato business

loans.name: Esther Naisaie

texts.en:
Esther Naisaie T. is 56 years old and a single mother of two children who are going to school. She sells fruits and vegetables in Naivasha town and also rears animals for resale.

Esther was introduced to KADET by her friend. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy five cows which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Esther hopes to buy land and build a family home.

loans.use: To buy five cows

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Тагоев Хуршед житель Яванского района. Ему 32 года. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Живет вместе с женой и детьми. Работает на рынке "Мехргон". У него магазин, где он продает мобильные телефоны и запасный части для них. Этим видом деятельности занимается 13 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения мобильных телефонов и запчастей.
texts.en: Khurshed T. lives in Yavan.  He is 32 years old, married, and has three children. He has a high school education.  He lives with his wife and children.  He works in the Mekhrgon market.  He has a shop where he sells mobile phones and repair parts for them.  He has been doing this for thirteen years.  He is taking out a loan to buy mobile phones and spare parts.

loans.use: buy mobile phones and spare parts

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella M. is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of her mother. Angella lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood in Kampala, Uganda. She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for her family.

Angella has been a retail shopkeeper for ten years, and she works seven days a week. The main business challenges Angella faces include seasonality and thieves.

Angella has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goals for her business are to go to the villages of the Nakasongola district for charcoal and to start selling charcoal at wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy pepper, palm oil, rice and salt

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cloth

loans.name: Zulaika's Group

texts.en:
Zulaika A. is the leader of this group. She resides in the ancient town of Uzgen, which is located in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  Zulaika is a 73 year-old widow.  She has raised eight children, who are all married and live separately with their families. 

To make money, Zulaika cultivates sunflowers and wheat.  Her daughters try to support Zulaika financially and each month they send her 5000 soms to cover her personal expenses.  Zulaika applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase fertilizers for farming. In the future she wants to improve her living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is 36 years old. She is married to a TV presenter. She has four children who are between eight and twelve years old. All her children attend school. Laurence sells clothes and she has been in this business for six years. She needs this loan to buy more clothes and clothing materials. With the profits she expects to establish a small textile boutique. 

She says that her business has allowed her to accomplish many of her dreams for both her business and her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more dozens of slippers

loans.name: Lucie

texts.en: Lucie is 57 years old. She is a widow and has five children who are between thirteen and twenty-four years old. Two of her children attend school while the others had to stop their studies due to insufficient funds. Lucie sells cereal grains and she has had this business for the period of sixteen years. She decided to request this loan to add  more cereals to sell. With the profit from this business she hopes to build her own residential house, as she currently lives in rental premises.  She is proud of her business because it makes a profit and enables her to feed the family.

loans.use: To buy more cereal grains to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crates of soft drinks, bags of rice and sacs of water

loans.name: Malikahan's Group

texts.en: Malikahan A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Uzgen, a beautiful ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 46 years old and divorced. She is bringing up a daughter and a son, both of whom are at school. In order to make money Malikahan prepares food and sells it. She started her business two years ago with the initial investment of 8,000 KGS, and now she earns about $86 per month. She applied for the loan because she needs money to pay for the rent of the building. In the future she wants to expand her business and improve the family's living conditions. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused micro-finance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only micro-finance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to pay for the rent

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.en:
N. Tolibjon is a very responsible and optimistic person. He has three children and a wife to support, so he wants to develop his business. This business consists of cattle-raising in his village because there is a very high demand for milk from villagers, and especially from customers who come from nearby towns. Tolibjon is helped by his children. He is currently faced with many problems because his children are growing and their expenses are growing accordingly. The only way to get out of this difficulty is to succeed in business, so we hope that his capabilities along with services provided by IMON International will help him improve his business.                                   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase small cattle for developing his business

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en: Hasmik H. has been trading in women's clothing since the 1990's. She regularly travels to the country markets where she sells the clothing, sometimes exchanging it for food. Hasmik’s family members have left their home in Russia and relocated to earn income. Notwithstanding all the hard work, Hasmik is a determined person with a perfect credit history. She has applied for the current loan to stock up on clothing to sell.

loans.use: To stock up on clothing to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 58 years old and married to Ernest. They are blessed with five children, ages 22, 20,19,18 and 16 years. She has been in the farming business for five years which earns her about $125 per month. Over this period she has been able to master the fast-moving farm products and also has identified potential clients, so she is most likely to excel.

She was introduced to Kadet by friends who have benefited from Kadet loans, and this is her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the anticipated profits to expand her business so as to boost her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and manure

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
O. Marhabo is 30 years old. She is married with three children. Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle. She walks through the farms and several settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price to be able to increase her profits. She currently has two cows. 

Now Marhabo wants to expand her business and, as her children are grown up, she thinks that she will be able to look after more cattle with their help. So she is asking for 5,500 TJS in order to purchase cattle. Marhabo expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase small cattle to expand the business and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a single lady aged 23 years.  She has been in the green grocery business for 3 years now and she also has a secondary business where she runs a salon.  From these two businesses she has been able to take care of herself and also cater for her expenses.

Zipporah was introduced to KADET LTD by friends who have benefited and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the money to add more stock of vegetables to her grocery business and she anticipates using the expected profits to expand her grocery business.

In the future she hopes to become a major supplier to other small green groceries in the area.

loans.use: Expansion of the business.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en: Davit A. operates an internet club providing internet and computer services.  Davit started by providing his services for free, following his University graduation.  After acquiring experience and permanent clients Davit has opened his own business, serving the local community’s increasing demand.  Davit is planning to use the loan to make two more computer cubicles.

loans.use: To make two more computer cubicles for his internet and computer services business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru: Азизов Али проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 65 лет. Женат. Имеет 7 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Али имеет среднее образование. Занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа скота. Он хочет закупить бычков для откормки и перепродажи.
texts.en: Ali A. lives in Yavan.  He is 65 years old, married, and has seven children.  His wife is a housewife. Ali has a high school education.  He works in animal husbandry.  He raises cattle at home, fattening and selling them.  He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.  He wants to buy calves for fattening and reselling.

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Behruz

texts.en:
R. Behruz is a very courageous man who is characterized as someone who can manage tough jobs like raising livestock.  He has one child and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need.  Inspite of his difficult economic situation, and after much time, Behruz has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of animals to breed on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family.  It's for this reason that Behruz comes to IMON International for loans for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule.  It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.  The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged the already weak economy  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle for breeding.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.ar:
محمد متزوج وله 3 اولاد له من العمر 51 سنة يعمل في تعهدات المنازل يحب عائلته ويريد لهم الحياة الكريمة  له تاريخ جيد
بالمجموعة يحب عمله جدا يريد ان يطور نفسه ويساعد عائلته على التطور يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بيك اب جديد
ليساعده في العمل لنقل البضائع له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه يريد ان يؤمن مستقبله لكي لا يجلس بدون عمل عندما لايستطيع ان يستلم تعهدات
يفكر في المستقبل له ولعائلته
texts.en: Mohammad, 51 years old, is married with three children. He works in transporting materials to houses. Mohammad loves his family and wishes to provide them with a decent life. He has a good credit history with Al Majmoua. Mohammad has a strong passion for his work. He wishes to promote himself and improve his family's living conditions.  Mohammad wants to get a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a new pickup to help him transport goods. Mohammad's clients are from his circle of friends and neighbors. He looks forward to securing  his future as he fears being unemployed and not being able to get work orders. He thinks about his own future as well as his family's.

loans.use: To buy a pickup to carry goods to houses

loans.name: Glory Be To God Group-Mukono

texts.en: 32 year G. Rose belongs to the Glory be to God Group- Jinja. she has been in business for 1 year, operating a beauty salon at home. Before she was doing mostly farming. Savings from the farming business came in handy in helping her take root in her salon enterprise. Rose is happily married with 6 kids, 4 of whom go to school. Weekly her profits are to the tune of shillings 50,000. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more hair dryers for her salon.

loans.use: The purchase of more hair dryers for her salon

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 61 years old and married to Nzuve who is 66 years old. Both are blessed with four children who are now grown up.  She has been in the livestock farming business for nine years which has made her name with her customers selling farm products and .

The fact that her children have grownup contributes room for her business growth since  she now has no dependents .She was introduced to Kadet by a friend and this is her first loan which she plans to use to buy farm supplies. She intends to use the anticipated profits to expand her business by practicing large scale farming in the future to boost her income.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more supplies of dishes

loans.name: Salohiddin

texts.en:
S. Salohiddin is 29 years old. He is married with two children. Salohiddin is dedicated to his agricultural business. Having little knowledge in the beginning, he had to learn a lot about farming. As of now, he has acquired a fair experience in agriculture.  Salohiddin is very happy, for his 2 children who are the motivation for his desire to grow his business. He approached IMON International to obtain a loan to buy more ingredients; seeds and fertilizer. This will enable him to sow for a good harvest and to take care of his children and his home.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is a 35 years old married man and father of three children, living in Bint Jbeil. Salim has sold fruits and vegetables since 2009.His business is new and he is constantly improving it. It’s the only suitable business in his area  and his clients claim his that  products are of good quality. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy stands to continue upgrading his shop. In this way he can add more space to add more products to put on display. Salim hopes to open a wholesale market in the future.

loans.use: To continue upgrading his shop

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan S. is married with two children. He and his young family live in his grandmother's home. The family's main income comes from agriculture.

While Vardan's grandmother takes care of the little children Vardan and his wife work hard. The young couple dream of owning their own home one day. To develop their business further Vardan is going to increase his livestock.

loans.use: Increasing livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, oil, onion, tomato etc. for sale at market

loans.name: Patrick Peter

texts.en:
Patrick is a 36-year-old man, married to Jennifer who is a housewife. They are blessed with three children aged ten, five and three years. 

Patrick earns Kshs 15,000 per month from his farming and transport businesses. He has been running these businesses for the last five years. This experience has enabled him to identify fast-moving farm products and also to identify trends relating to his transport business. 

He was introduced to KADET by friends who have benefited from KADET loans, and this is his first loan. He plans to purchase farm stock worth Kshs 30,000. He hopes to become a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of farm stock worth Ksh 30,000

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is 39 years old and married to Monica, who is a housewife. They are blessed with six children.

Augustine has been in the food business for 15 years and has loyal customers. He also has a secondary business, selling charcoal, which supplements the income he gets from the food kiosk, and helps him to meet his expenses. In total he makes a profit of Ksh 11,700 per month.

He was introduced to KADET by friends who had joined before him and he has applied for a loan to buy more stock of food stuffs, such as onions, tomatoes, cabbages and potatoes for his business. He plans to expand the business from the anticipated profits.

His dream is to educate his children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: Stocking of food kiosk

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.en:
Abdulaziz S. lives in Istaravshan, a city in Northern Tajikistan. He is 31 years old and married with four children. 

Abdulaziz is the sole provider for his family and earns a living from his farming and animal husbandry business. Every 2-3 months he purchases young animals from local villagers and raises them over a 5-6 month period, later selling the adult cows and sheep to local butchers.

Abdulaziz is currently thinking about expanding his business, as his current earnings are not enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase more young cattle. For this reason he is requesting a loan of 5500 Somoni.

Extend your solidarity to Abdulaziz so that he can move forward successfully and accomplish his goals. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more medicine

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.ru:
Gulzar A. 54 qoda. Ona zamujem i imeyet odnovo rebonka kotoriy uchitsya v kolledje. Gulzar yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli i seychas projivayet v Fizuli region Bala Behmenli posolok vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 

Gulzar uje 5 let imeyet Kafe. Gulzar uje dva raza brala ssudu i ona ochen blagodarna lenderam za pomosh. Gulzar seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit posudu dlya svoyeqo kafe, ona xochet kupit noviy serviz i nabor vilok lojek i nabor stakanov. Guluzar i v pervoy ssude i vo vtoroy vseqda delala platejku v svoyo vremya bez zaderjok.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/4512

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/95065
texts.en:
Gulzar A. is 54 years old. She is married and has one child, who is a college student. Gulzar is an Internally Diplaced Person. She is a refugee from [the town of] Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli Region, in the village of Bala Behmenli, together with her family. For five years already, Gulzar has been running a café. She took out loans twice in the past and is very grateful to the lenders for their help. At present Gulzar needs 2000 AZN to purchase  new plates for her care. She would like to buy a new set of dinnerware as well as a set of silverware and glassware. Gulzar repaid her first and second loan on time, always making each payment promptly.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/4512

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/95065

loans.use: Purchasing new plates for her cafe

loans.name: Klichboy

texts.en:
Klichboy is 44 years old, married, and has one son. He is a farmer growing vegetables, something he has done for 6 years. This is the only thing he knows how to do and what he likes most. For Klichboy, there is nothing better than being in touch with nature and watching the fruit of his labor grow year after year.

 In addition, Klichboy raises cattle and his family helps him with his business. Now he wants to borrow money to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants in order to grow seasonal vegetables. This is the fourth loan of Klichboy from IMON International and he promises to repay the current loan without any violations and thanks all lenders for their support.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.
