loans.use: Purchasing seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more underclothes

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Samer is 29 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in Bint Jbeil.  For nine years, Samer has been working in construction in the digging field.  He is well known in the business as most of the constructors deal with him.  Samer is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a BOBCAT necessary for his business.  He hopes to expand his business in the future through buying more BOBCATS and to make a better future for his family.

loans.use: To buy a BOBCAT necessary for his business

loans.name: Sonik

texts.en: Sonik H.  has been in sales since the 1990s. Currently Sonik is selling curtains, bed linens, and covers from a rented booth in “Petak” market. One of her two sons helps Sonik in running the business. Sonik is her hard-working family’s partner, leading her family members to sustainability. Sonik has applied for the loan to purchase new stock.

loans.use: purchasing new stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Joseph Letuwuon

texts.en:
Joseph, who is 25 years old, was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town for the last five years and now he wants to diversify; thus, the reason for borrowing this loan. He will buy 15 sheep that he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, he hopes to run a profitable business so that his family may live a comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep that he will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 53-year-old married woman with one son. She is the owner of a grocery store in Bint Jbeil. Zeinab’s store is her major source of income and she works hard on improving it. 

Zeinab is requesting  a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase her capital, which will lead to an increase in her income. She hopes to provide a secure and good living for her family and to expand her business through opening a wider store.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Hadji

texts.en:
Hadji is 25 years old and a married lady. She has been in the hawking business, selling goods door-to-door or by calling out from the street, for six years. She is applying for her  third loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh), which she intends to use to purchase more stock of home products and to pay council levies. She repaid her previous two loans successfully.

There is clear indication that her business is doing well; her monthly profit is Ksh 15,000. She plans to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to rent a structure where she could establish her business. She hopes and dreams of getting settled with a well-stocked shop.

loans.use: To purchase stock and pay council levies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase slippers

loans.name: Malik

texts.ru:
Malik N. 54 qoda . On yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda , seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione. Malik  jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye pomoqayut yemu po rabote. 

Malik uje 12 let kak yavlyayetsya skotovodom , on ochen lubit jivotnix i poetomu ochen lubit svoyu rabotu. Malik zanimayestya prodajey molochnix produktov v maqazini. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Malika v perviy raz on bral $750  i za etu ssudu on ochen blagodaren lenderam. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi , dlya toqo chtobi uvelichit kolichestvo molochnix produktov dlya prodaji i tem samim uvelichit yejemesechniy doxod.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/51997
texts.en:
Malik N. is 54 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region.  Malik is married and has two children who help him in his work.

Malik has been a herdsman for twelve years.  He loves animals very much and therefore loves his work.  Malik sells dairy products in a store.  This is Malik’s second loan.  The first time, he borrowed $750.  He is very grateful to lenders for that loan.  Now, he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows.  This will increase his production of dairy products, thereby increasing his income.

His first loan can be seen here: http://partners.kiva.org/lend/51997

loans.use: Buying cows
